Everyone we encountered from the hostess, wait staff, and bar tenders were all very friendly and made our experience here a very positive one! Can't wait to come back!

Dandelion Market is a pretty great tapas bar right in the thick of things in Charlotte. I highly recommend the Sweet Pototao Gnocchi and Korean BBQ Short Ribs! Great atmosphere and very helpful staff.

Met up with family from Asheville and Atlanta.  Great place to enjoy small plates of goodness!  Started with the Southern Caprese - fried green tomatoes with mozzarella and a fig balsamic drizzle.  Added the pepperoni & mozzarella & pesto flatbread and fried pickles with horsey aiol.  Nice start with good flavor.  Round 2 - Red Pepper Artichoke Dip, Shrimp and grits with goat cheese & a red pepper cream sauce--interesting as we first thought the shrimp was sitting on a crouton - actually was a "grit cake", creative!  Round 3 - Black Bean Sliders with house made guacamole and a grilled green tomato,  Pommes Frites.    Last round was a doozy - Market Mac-n-cheese with smoked pepper and buttered breadcrumbs and the Cherry Glazed Lamb Lollipops served medium rare with black cherries along side a spring mix with a feta vinaigrette....OHHHH MYYYY!  Lamb was the hit!!  All that can be said is "we'll be back to try the rest of the menu!"  Katie took wonderful care of us!  Wine specials on Tuesdays.  Nice craft selection of draft beer.  Plan to stay because you'll want to linger over every bite!

I found this place accidentally.  I was looking for a place for lunch and headed down a street filled with neon signs. A lot of people spilled out the door so I decided to give it a try. I sat at the bar. I ordered a Pelligrino orange and a seared ahi salad.  Steven the bartender is personable and polite.  I'm looking forward to my meal. The drink was nice and fizzy & it was served in a wine glass with a slice of fresh orange. The salad had a good portion of seared tuna & some nice greens. It was hearty & quick. I will go there again. (2/28/2013)

i used to shy away from small plate eateries thinking why pay so much for so little. Then i realized it pretty much works out for us as the cost equivalent to 2 entrees minus the excess food forcing me to stuff myself.    We were craving absolutely nothing, so we decided to just go Uptown for dinner on a weeknight. We ended up parking on Church Street and wandered down to Dandelion Market. Two seats had just opened at the bar with no wait, so the bar we sat. The bar lady was very friendly and wore a real smile the whole night. They still have a solid beer list and the fact that they have $3 beers on Mondays sounds amazing given its Uptown location.   We had the zucchini salad, baked potato croquettes, and the trio of spreads. The pita that came with the spreads had a garlic taste with a nice touch of salt. A single spread didn't stand out over the others, but enjoyed them all. This was the most filling of our plates. The potato croquettes were good, but only came with 4 little potato thingies which seemed small even for a small plate. The scallion cream that came with the potatoes was very light and added very little flavor, just a damp texture. The zucchini salad was cuts of zucchini lengthwise with a dressing, a few craisins and cheese. A solid opening dish.   Overall, we had great beer, good food, and excellent service and i would definitely recommend this place for a weeknight dinner and drink.
Pretty good. Very much so willing to help make food vegan. The Minni bean burgers rock!!  Thanks.  Sprouts were happy too.

UPDATE:  Dandelion Market has updated their outdoor signs, and website to accommodate wheelchair users that cannot fully access the establishment!   They provided A.D.A. accomodations by training staff, updating signages outside and offering patrons curbside take out.  Thank you to everyone invloved for making the accommodations for wheelchair patrons.

I stopped in here with my father for Sunday brunch.  As we walked in the door I immediately felt comfortable, like we had walked into the right place.  The atmosphere is cool and laid back.  I also noticed the nice Bloody Mary bar which was conveniently located right in the middle of the restaurant.  While I did not partake, I most certainly would recommend it for anyone who enjoys Bloody Marys.  Our waitress was very nice and attentive, making sure our coffee and water never ran out.  I ordered the veggie benedict which was really excellent.  My dad ordered sausage, eggs, and grits.  The grits were really good and made just the way I like them.  The sausage was in large links rather than patties which was a bit unexpected.  My father did not particularly like the sausage.  I tried it and it was indeed a bit different, but I enjoyed it.  This is really a great place and I'm glad I finally got the chance to try it for myself.  All in all really good experience and I look forward to coming back!

So yeah, solid small plates for the most part, good beer selection and a cozy enviroment.  It is more of a pre game spot for going out since it does get uncomfortably crowded on weekends in the late evening.  A bit "fratty", and I think they have a polo shirt check at the door, but whatever--still good food and drinks to chill out on.

I'm going to keep this brief.  For some reason I don't feel like Dandelion warrants my trademark longish reviews.  I'm not really passionate about this place, but I've been twice and it warrants a review.  The good:  The food.  Very very good and I feel like there's a good variety of unique offerings.  The bad:  The price.  The plates are tapas style and to get anywhere near 'full' be prepared to drop 40 large per person...not including alcohol or tip.  That's why I think I'm just so Meh on this place. There are far better offerings in Charlotte where I can pay 40-50 a head and actually be full and satisfied.  I'm never full or satisfied when I leave Dandelion.

Ambiance  - awesome decor, flattering lighting, trendy, great vibe!  Dinner food - really delicious and fresh. Good variety.  Brunch food - taste was great, keep in mind this is not the place to go if you watch what you eat. I didn't see any lean meats available, it's all pork, sausage, beef etc. If you want to go veggie there will be lots of cheese. As long as you're ready and want to embrace it you will like it here because the flavor is great.  They are also really good about modifying, as they are cook to order as well. Also, do not look at the menu linked with Yelp because it's not accurate, just go to their website. They probably change it often, which keeps it fresh.   Drinks, great selection. Tons of beers on draft. Lots of cocktails and wines. Drinks are more pricey than other places close by.  Late night this place is a party upstairs, not a restaurant. Lots of attractive young people. Like 22-27 years olds. If that's you, you're in luck. Lots more girls than guys too. Maybe this is where we go to hide, so maybe I shouldn't announce that, but most people that are still reading this are females anyway. ;)

very disappointed. in town for 1 night and looking for a great way to introduce my daughter to uptown Charlotte. this place had some pretty good reviews and appeared to be just what I was looking for.  wrong!  first of all, it's like eating in a bar/pub - very loud.  the food was average at best as was the service.   certainly not my idea of a tapas place.  wouldn't recommend it.

I am absolutely a fan, a veteran fan at that.  I began going to Dandelion Market before it drew it's large nightly weekend crew, and before they began charging cover for guys.  I really love the bartenders, and the environment.  The bartenders remember me whether I've been there a few times within one week or if I haven't been there in over 3 weeks.  The atmosphere is also nice because it offers a dichotomas separation between party dance thumping (upstairs) and a busy pub atmosphere downstairs.  I've also tried some of their food before and was pleasently surprised.  My only reason for not giving Dandelion Market 5 stars is because the upstairs section on weekend is not equipt to handle the amount of people coming in.  It has been increasingly difficult to get a drink, or to even have a decent amount of room to dance.  After 11 on a Friday and Saturday leads to something I call the Sardine Effect.  I'm sure you can figure that one out.    I've had many good times here but you just have to pick and choose the nights you come or be prepared for a more crowded scene (on the weekends)!

The food tasted amazing BUT there were 8 of us and everyone's order came at a different time. We were there eating for hours and it shouldn't take long to eat these tiny portions. 2 of us ordered shrimp and grits and they came out 20 minutes apart. Could they not fit 4 small shrimp on the grill at the same time? Same thing with the steak skewers. It's pricey. If you're hungry be prepared to spend a lot.

Baked potatoes croquettes, simple and delicious. Pizza flatbread, lol, just a pizza, was ok. Grilled flat iron strip steak, not tough and great flavor, Italian sausage stuffed Pompano pepper, my favorite dish of all the ones we tried. Again, simple and very good. Our server Rachel was friendly and attentive.

Love love this place, food is great, it's kind of a tapas place , they do catered for a younger crowd, sit and mingle kind if this. It's is also kind of a tapas place very small plate, but very tasty. I love the fried pickle, my favorite. Price is very reasonable 3 of us and we order a few plates and my husband had 1 glass of wine and our bill was like $45.00. I  just wish the had parking, cause I was pregnant and the walking distant was not that close from where we park.

Good spot for Sunday brunch. I've only been there twice but the food was good and the service was solid both times. If you like omelets and seafood, I recommend the Carolina Shore. It was fantastic. I paired it with the hash browns (they were ok but not the best) and a Bellini. Overall it was a delicious meal and perfect for post workout!

I was visiting Charlotte on business and needed to grab dinner somewhere near my hotel. After wandering up and down the street, I finally decided to step into Dandelion Market, which my local coworker recommended to me. Despite its name, Dandelion is a bar that serves tapas and feels very much like a bar rather than a restaurant. At just before 8 pm on a Tuesday evening, there was plentiful seating downstairs and upstairs and no wait for me. I was attended to frequently throughout my visit and appreciated the service! 2-3 small dishes per person are recommended.   I ordered the pan seared scallops ($17) and mac and cheese ($8). The scallops are on a bed of collard greens and something else (I wasn't able to identify it by taste or in the dim atmosphere of the bar) and sauce. The sauce was a bit on the salty side for me, but it was still tasty.   The mac and cheese was very cheesy and tasty; I'd say it would place #2 or #3 on the list of "fancy" mac and cheese dishes I've had. Not the most amazing but definitely savory!

This place is my kind of bar.  Really extensive craft beer menu, which includes tap dates. I had the same bartender each of the three times I went, and he remembered what I and each member of my party had ordered the previous time.  I was totally comfortable telling the bartender to "give me something great," and trust he'd pull a good beer for me.  He did not disappoint.  As other yelpers have said, there are two floors, with the upstairs having a hidden DJ loft, and a large table which lifts to the ceiling on weekends to create a dance floor.  To be honest, I much preferred the earlier part of the week, where quiet blues was playing and some baseball was on the TV, to the later, louder week with the Lady Gaga and the shiny-shirted ladies and gelled gents, but that's just my scene.  The beer, the staff, and the service were great.

Great service, friendly bar tender and great food. Can't beat the hours, brunch until 3pm? A bar that doesn't close? This is my kind of place. Will be back later tonight for the DJ. Awesome stop on my weekend away in the Queen City!!

If I could give them 10 stars I would.  The food was great but the Service was amazing.  Being told we appreciate your business and also acting like it goes a long way.  We ate upstairs at the bar and all three bartenders frequently checked on us. We had the lamb, stuffed pepper, Brussel sprouts and sliders.  Sliders we a little dry but everything else was very good.  Dessert was my favorite, Apple pie ravioli, a must try if you eat there.  Drinks were also creative and yummy.

This is a nice, funky tapas-style eatery in uptown. But I think the food's a little pricey and the portions too large to be a traditional tapas place. My GF and I ordered three plates each, thinking that we'd order more, but the portions were so large that the six were more than enough. The frites and calamari, for example, were as large as a standard appetizer at a "regular" restaurant. I'm sure Dandelion Market has run the numbers and decided that this is the way to go; however I would have preferred it if the portions and prices were split in half, so I could try a greater variety of things. Then again, my GF is mostly vegetarian and I am not - perhaps if we ate with a few more friends the cost would even out more.  Having said all that, the food was good. The Ale Simmered Sausage bites weren't as warm as I would have hoped, but the sauce was delicious. The calamari was tender and well-cooked. The sliders were delicious, although the toppings threatened to overwhelm the meat. The frites were perfectly cooked and delicious. The baked potato croquettes were tasty and homey. The fried pickles were great, albeit with an "upscale" take. The beer menu is nice and well thought out. The service was friendly and efficient. The decor was funky - a mix of old Dublin pub and modern hipster hangout (old burlap sacks stretched and and hung like pictures, or example).  My only complaint (save what I wrote in the first paragraph) is that this place might prove to be a bit.. twee for Charlotteans.

We had brunch at this location, My wife can't remember what she had, only that she wasn't too impressed with it. I had the Low Country Hash, which didn't taste bad but was a heavy as a ton of bricks.   Service was not too bad but a bit slow and inexperienced both - kids.   I used the Bloody Mary bar, I don't find it "creative" I'd much rather have a competent bartender make my drinks. I get the impression that their target market is not a dining crowd but young singles in search of booze and loud music  - not for me.

Great place and reasonable prices.  I have been to several "small plates" restaurants and have found most of them to be too trendy for their own good. Over priced and undersized portions. Dandelion Market was the antithesis of that thinking. I started with the Red Pepper Artichoke Dip, it was delicious and the crispy pitas were a perfect pairing. The Shrimp and Grits were flavorful with a nice presentation using fried squares of grits and beautifully prepared shrimp, but I should have opted for the larger portion because it was just that good! I also tried the Lamb Lollipops at the recommendation of a friend. They were cooked to perfection and the addition of cherry to the flavor was delightful. I just hope other diners weren't off-put by my cleaning of the wonderful crisp lamb bones.  When the bill came I was astonished, all this food for around $25. This place will definitely be on my list. I need to bring others with me so we can try a wider array of their small plates.
Ahi tuna was amazing! Flatbread cured pepperpni is great. Calamari is good.  Ehhh on mac n cheese and sweet potatoes gnocchi ...would probably get something else. Sauces on all was well done.

Good food and great atmosphere. Make sure to go for lunch one day when it's not crowded and just enjoy the scene. I took my father here for lunch and he got a roast beef sandwich and chicken fajita soup. He henhouse his. I got a grilled cheese and tomato soup. Very appetizing. Bonus, we took some engagement pictures inside and outside and lt added a cute uptown Charlotte touch!

Great atmosphere, good selection of beer. And oh yeah, my roommate works here.  The overall restaurant had a nice social vibe to it. With two floors, two bars, this place was definitely a place for bar food and drinks. Great selection of beer and sampling was a lot of fun the first time I went there.  The fried calamari was really good, I enjoyed it a lot with the sauce complementing it. The other food was also delicious, a bit pricey, but overall it's not a place to eat to be full. Drink and be merry here!

Grilled wings.....amazing!  Sliders...good  Drinks - specialty joints...amazing  Atmosphere...awesome. love the chill vibe, feels like a low key spot but you can tell it's a neighborhood gem. Glad I walked in to explore this joint. Love it.

I wish I could give this bar a 0. We did not enter because the staff were so disrespectful and rude to my friend and I (two women). We walked by two places next door to Dandelion that were packed with lines to get in. We wanted to go because we had been the previous night and enjoyed it. The men outside were demeaning and rude beyond belief, bringing us to tears. I have recently moved to Charlotte and will never come here again and will 100% encourage all of my young friends to do the same. It is such a shame because I think it is a fun place but I will never accept being treated like that.

Went here on a Saturday with my gfs and surprisingly it was dead.  We were quickly prompted to sit by the table bar area. Decoration is a bit bland. Nothing too appealing. I ordered the Ahi tuna salad, which was really good! I forgot what my gfs ordered but they said their food was delicious.  Minus one star for limited parking spaces. Ughh we had to park by a garage that was a bit far of a walk but other than that service and food were great.

Went to this place for a late dinner and the $15 bottles of wine on Tuesdays.  The food was absolutely amazing. The small plates are the perfect size to try a few things. The scallops and lamb were the best that I have had in a long time.   The service was great as well. Our waitress gave great recommendations and was extremely friendly. I would recommend this spot to anyone passing through Charlotte.

Quick late review - in Charlotte over Mother's Day weekend, stopped in here (based on a recommendation from friends) for a late lunch after Discovery Place.  Combination of soups, salads, grilled cheese and sliders.  The sliders were a bit dried out, but everything else was awesome.  Almost 5 stars.
I can't wait to come back to this place!! Everything we ordered was delish- Shrimp and grits, spinach artichoke dip, goat cheese crostinis and wings!! Can't beat the beer specials either.

We are just visiting Charlotte and the Dandelion is very close... They have a great but not extensive list of Carolina craft beers but what they have was delicious .... I tried the locals and it's great, not good, not exceptional, but 9 have to admit, it worked very well with the lunch, tomato soup and grill cheese and a salad... the salad was huge by-the-by... the dressing that is available is phenomenal, Italian, lemon Italian, balsamic Italian... actually, try them together, amazing flavors... missing the last star because this was our only visit...
Brunch Bloody Mary's. Mimosas.  Nice small portioned tasty food . Not stellar service but Good for a brunch.
Came with a group of girls a month ago, had a great time and excellent service. Bloody Mary's Bar!!!!

Visited Dandelion Market with friends on Saturday 11/14/15.  Have visited this location before and had loved it.  We were having a wonderful experience till the food stopped coming out.  We had several appetizers come out no problem.  Our sides showed up and then for 30 minutes no food.  Why order sides if you don't have real food to enjoy them with, so we asked to see the manager.  She had such a chip on her shoulder and told us this is the way their restaurant runs.  She blamed the server for not explaining properly how things work and was very defensive and said she would check on things.  We finally received a steak skewer and then 20 minutes later 2 shrimp but when you have four people at the table, we are hungry.  The manager came back and again repeated her excuse for the delay in food and while we were talking with her the remaining 2 dishes came out.  This manager has very poor communication skills blaming the customer and the server.  I hope they find a new manager.
Great Bar upstairs the Beer selection was large enough to please any beer snob.

Really love this place. Just moved to Charlotte and make it a goal to take all my future visitors here for Sunday Brunch.  Has a very authentic Irish Pub/Hobbit Shire feeling to it.  This would almost be enough for me except that there breakfast and lunch and Brunch menus happen to be fairly unique and delicious from what I've tried. From what Ive hear and from my 3 experiences eating here, I would say that you can't really go wrong.  I will be back.

First time for brunch and mixed feelings. I got the veggie Bennie which was kind of weird.  I like the concept but it's tough to cut through the portabella. Also used waaayyyyy too much hollandiase.   Bf got the low country hash which was awesome. Lots of flavor and just the right size.  Yummy drinks and free biscuits definately made up for the lackluster entree.

This has to be one of my favorite places in Uptown, deserving of a repeat visit. Come in early, and be prepared to get more than you expected because your eyes will be bigger than your appetite. The drinks here are amazing -- the Holy Water is my boyfriend's favorite, although I really liked the Twinkle Toes myself.  As for food, you can't really go wrong with anything on the menu. It's split up into sections for small appetizer plates, staples, house favorites, and surf and turf. My boyfriend and I pick about 4 plates and that's enough for two -- and of course, if you have lots of guests for dinner (or just big appetites), you can get everything on the menu for $295. The last time we went, we ordered fried pickles (that horseradish aioli is amazing with the pickles), sliders (you get two), sweet potato gnocchi (soft, with a nice sweet potato and cinnamon background with the cream sauce), and the croquettes (perfectly fried and definitely reminded me of a baked potato, especially with the cream sauce that came with it.)  Plates come as they are ready and the service is great. They also feature amazing desserts -- we got a cookies and cream cheesecake and it was definitely a good end to an amazing dinner.

We were only in Charlotte for one night, and Dandelion Market was where we started our Charlotte adventure. We passed by this place and said to ourselves "this could be cool". The place is pretty dark but still manages to keep a cozy, southern feel.  And so we sat at the bar at around 5 or 6 pm on a Friday night. It was pretty empty, so we sat down at the bar and began chit-chatting with our bartender. I think his name was Drew. Really cool guy!   I was pretty surprised that with the awesome beer selection at the bar (Arrogant Bastard on TAP..? Wow! ) , the place was empty for just after 5pm on a Friday. That was until some guy dressed in full-on J Crew prep wear sat down at the bar and ordered a Miller Light.... huh??!   We soon found out that Dandelion Market is more into the nightlife scene. We spent most of our visit watching staff and 7-8 bartenders prepare for the night to come. Stocking glasses, making sure there were enough lemons and cherries, etc.  Our bartender clued us in on other awesome places to check out while we were in CLT, which was much appreciated. We did visit most places that he recommended, and we felt like we got a really good feel for the city. +1 for awesome staff!  I don't think I'd be interested in visiting this place when they turn to crazy nightlife bar. It seems like they are going for two different crowds depending on the day and time, which I guess works for them. If I come back to CLT though, I'd be happy to return here for a beer or two.

I love this place! It's laid back and equally comfortable for eating or drinking regardless of the hour and the setting appeals to everyone from the younger banking crowd to country-looking people. It's one of the few places that you'll feel comfortable dressed really nicely or very modestly. I can't comment on their food because I've never tried it and the drink specials aren't usually too cheap but it IS uptown after all

Had dinner here with coworkers and everything was really enjoyable. Portions were good for the price and each small dish satisfied the four of us. The pommes frites were awesome and my favorite- slightly battered, crispy and hot. We also had scallops, meatballs (these were just okay-a bit firm but good flavor), prosciutto crostini (almost like a dessert), portobello fries, wings (little dry), and lamb lollipop (yum-great flavor and perfectly cooked medium). If I'm back in the area will definitely come again.

Went with some co-workers on a fairly quiet Tuesday night. First impression - very comfortable atmosphere, reminds me a bit of RiRa. Place looks like it's been there forever. . .really like the table layout and the big common picnic table in the middle of the first floor.  Food: as others have stated, this is a pseudo-tapas place, but with a Gaelic twist. There are the usual standards (calamari, wings, beer fondue) and some really interesting unusual items (duck flatbread pizza, fried oysters, fried sage leaves). Everything we tried was very good, portions were generous. In particular the crostini and sage leaves were excellent, the lamb lollypops were also very good but you need to like your lamb rare.  Drinks: Very cool, local, unusual beer selection. A plethora of wine selections under $25 per bottle, which is nice.  Service: Prompt, polite, and easy. Who could ask for more?  Overall this place is a welcome addition to Uptown and I will visit again!
Ok but not great.  We ordered a wide variety of dishes, but the food seemed to have a very narrow range of taste.  Service was slow-ish

I really love this place. I've been here three times now- for dinner tapas, lunch with a girl friend and also for Sunday brunch. It's in my neighborhood and has a wide variety of things to choose from- we got a ton of small plates to choose from (caprese to salmon cakes to brussel sprouts) when we came for dinner, which was perfect for two people to share. Shortly after I met a friend for lunch, where we both got grilled cheese and tomato soup- so great for these unseasonably cold winter days.  So brunch is interesting- it's served until 3 and all their specialty items look amazing. I settled on the hash and my BF got the migas. I loved my hash- full of potatoes, andouille sausage and okra- spiced to perfection and not too filling. The migas were pretty eggy though- definitely could have used more fillings and less egg. I also noticed a bloody mary bar (we just got coffee), which is also a cute brunch touch.
Never a bad meal. The grilled cheese and tomato soup is amazing and just about everything on the dinner menu has been delish!

The best just keeps getting better.  Somehow in all my trips to Dandelion Market, I'd never been seated upstairs.  That changed this morning at Sunday brunch, and the upstairs room is even cooler than the downstairs room!  Upstairs is huge with tall ceilings, exposed brick, and a full-body knight's armor in the corner.  A long, dark wood table fills the middle and was hosting a small party this morning, and booths and tables line the perimeter.  The bar was long and inviting, and the bar stools looked super cushy and comfortable.  As always the food was delicious, and the eggs are still massive!  I can't wait to go back for a drink and sit at the upstairs bar.

Dandelion Market never seems to disappoint. I've been there for dinner, late nights and now mostly lunch.   So on my most recent visit, we were there for lunch. We had a small wait for a table of four. The space does seem a little small for lunch time and typically the upstairs isn't open at this time. At this time of day you can order small plates or from the lunch menu.   I was super impressed that there were so many veggie friendly options. Recently I've switched to a plant-based diet and eating out can be hard. I actually had options here! I ordered a portabella sandwich with a side salad. The sandwich was delicious. The mushroom wasn't too rubbery or juicy. The pesto sauce and garlic  aoili were nice additions. And the ciabbata bread was a perfect match. The salad was also good, but pretty basic with mixed spring greens and cherry tomatoes and a basalmic vinegrette on the side. As a meal, it was very satisfying.   I'd love to come back for brunch sometime. But I highly recommend Dandelion Market for any occassion.

I have been to Dandelion several times and really enjoy it! Lunch and dinner menus are completely different. Lunch offerings are simple and fairly limited.   For the first time I got the wild mushroom flatbread and simple salad. Well they aren't kidding when they say simple salad! It literally is a plate of mixed greens and that's it! The balsamic vinaigrette is creamy (how of they do that) and delicious! My flatbread was delicious, cheesy and perfectly cooked! But I have to admit I was disappointed as all it had on there were sliced button mushrooms. I do not consider those wild mushrooms! Regardless it was tasty!  Dinner is always a treat as they offer a huge tapas menu! Can't wait to go back for dinner!

My friend and I randomly strolled in here for dessert one Sunday eve, after my normal cupcake spot was closed. Best decision I ever made!!! They had a car bomb cupcake made with Guiness and Bailey's I think. 0_0... It was warm, and chocolatey, and everything I hoped and wished for. I will definitely be going back for lunch or dinner!!! The ambiance was great for a posh evening or a date. Staff was very friendly too! :)
Great service, food and ambiance. The bar upstairs is cool. The lollipop lamb chops are delicious. I had he cheese board to start which was very good. Good wine and beer selection.

Grabbed a late lunch here with my husband & the food was delicious! I had the grilled cheese & tomato soup, he had the roast beef. Both on thick cut toasted sourdough bread. The atmosphere was quaint and cozy. There were several vegetarian options, which was nice. I didn't partake, but the bloody mary bar for brunch folks was a nice touch and looked like it had a good variety.

Unfortunately, their menu descriptions are not accurate. For example, I believe pork products MUST be disclosed in the ingredients of a dish, but that was not the case. I ordered two dishes: Mac and cheese and scallops with collard greens. Both dishes contained bacon without it being disclosed on the menu.

Dandelion Market is an excellent choice if you don't have a big appetite. they have some amazing dishes under Small bites section. This place is bit loud but filled with fun and excitement. Shrimp and grits and the lamb lollipops are must eat !!

We were looking for a place to get lunch since the place we wanted to go to had a 30 minute wait time, and we were hangry! Had this place bookmarked & figured 5 min walk, why not? Walked in and they weren't busy at all, it's a small place with a bar and some tables. We came in at 3 and they told us they still served brunch- yasss! They gave us some bread to start out with, it was okay. I felt like it could be better if it was warmed up a bit. I ordered the caprese benny, lord it was so eggy! I feel like there wasn't enough bread on the bottom, but I really enjoyed the hollandaise sauce & the bread that it came on though! I tried some of the hash browns, and grits lorrrd the hash browns were SO salty!! But the grits were really interesting, it tasted like there was corn bits in it? Very good! But the service was supppper slow. Mind you there like 2 tables in there including ours but our server was so. slow. The food took a while to come out, and we had a hard time flagging him down for a refill & the check. Plus it was super chilly in there! :(
It's a nice booshie uptown place to go. Great food and ambiance.

Visited this little gem back in Sept. We found it from YELP reviews. This place was just what we were looking for small plates bursting with flavor. It is quite dark so if you go at night sit by a light to see the menu. Give it a try you may like it!

If this place were $2 cheaper per plate for lunch or offered that much of a discount on some things given a certain day, my co-workers and I might consider frequenting Dandelion Market weekly or multiple times per week. The lunch menu is simple, but delicious and well presented. Over the course of 3 visits in parties of 4+, everyone has loved their food. From the simple touches of "Guinness spiced ketchup" to the super crispy fries, everything is fantastic food wise.  What is not fantastic is that the lunch plates costs $8-10, and will run you $12-15 after taxes and tip. It is definitely competitive in the uptown lunch space for quality of food within that price range, but at the same time, uptown Charlotte has many overpriced lunch eateries.  Using Restaurant.com, you can average down the bill for Dandelion to $8-10 after tax and tip, which makes it much more exciting to frequently visit. Limited menu, but I'd get it over and over... and over.

My husband and I visited Dandelion Market for dinner on our drive down to Florida for our honeymoon. I had heard that Charlotte had a great food scene, so we figured it was a good place to stop along the route.   We shared five small plates: arugula salad, prosciutto crostini, sweet and sour green beans, spicy potatoes, and black bean sliders. The arugula salad was large and refreshing after a few days of eating meals on the road. The potatoes were cooked wonderfully -- tender with delicious crispy bites -- but the spicy tomato sauce topping was a bit too hot for my taste. The green beans were my husband's choice; I'm not much of a green bean fan, but with the sweet sauce and macadamia nut topping, these were probably the best I've ever had. The crostini were my favorite item: creamy goat cheese and crispy prosciutto. We were underwhelmed by the lack of flavor in the black bean sliders at first, but they grew on us by the last bite.  But by far the best part of our Dandelion Market was the service. Our server was friendly and attentive, and when he found out we were on our honeymoon, he served us a free apple turnover and vanilla ice cream dessert, which was a phenomenal way to end the meal. We left the restaurant full and happy!
Came here for brunch and we were not disappointed. Their Low country hash is wonderful and filling. Prosciutto Benny was really good as well, but it was a smaller portion. Will be back!
This is my favorite go to place in uptown. The portobello fries are amazing. They have a great beer selection.

Fabulous evening. Friendly staff. Roomy decor for a downtown spot. Lots of choices with a variety of taste profiles. Sweet, asian, fresh and bright tuna poke was a great start. Lamb kebabs added a smoky Morroccan flavor. They were spectacular. Brussels sprouts with golden beets and bacon added a little vegetable and a rich, earthly tasting dish. Seasoned broiled scallops were in a tamarind sauce and a perfect end for our savory foods. We saved room for dessert: a brownie Sunday. Service throughtout is friendly, he session, but not in any way intrusive. Excellent!

This is a really cute place.. it's for the most part very good. We enjoyed the Mac and cheese and asparagus... wouldn't recommend the fries.. they are literally frozen crinkle cut fries at a high price (not what I expected).. I also wouldn't recommend the sea dog cocktail. It was $14 and it really did just taste like ocean water.

Awesome service (for lunch at least). Our waitress was very nice, and suggested the tomato soup grilled cheese. We went with that and a side of the fries. Absolutely delicious. So much so that we have ordered the same thing on door dash a couple times even though we live right down the street. Just what you want on a rainy day. Definitely Recommend.
I had the opportunity to visit this place last night for the Hendricks Gin Cocktail hour.  It was great.  I will definitely be back.  Con:  like most places Uptown, parking.

Holy cow. I mean I'm actually mad at myself for living here all this time and never coming into this place for food. Hands down some of the best food Ive had in awhile. I came here with my best friend Stefanie and our style is always to order a bunch of items and share them as well as a bottle of wine. They had half price bottles that night so it was an easy decision. We shared the mussels and I have to say they were probably the best mussels Ive had not at the beach. The other item I ordered were the crab cakes. Now I like to think of myself as a sort of crab cake connoisseur.  If a restaurant has them I will order them. This was to die for. I was not only impressed I have been talking to my guy about them since the night we went. I will be dragging him there very shortly and now that I'm talking about it it will probably be tomorrow.   The service was also amazing we sat at the bar uptstairs and our bartender was attentive knowledgable and friendly. The prices were more than fair and for the quality of food to be honest they could charge more.   Dandelion market is uptown so the parking situation can be just that a situation. Its totally worth whatever you have to go through to get there though. I honestly cannot wait to go back and would recommend this to anyone with tastebuds.

Wow.  I absolutely loved this place.  I was in from out of state and this was on my hosts' MUST TRY list because they love the menu and the atmosphere.  I couldn't agree more, it's fantastic.  Our party of 4 arrived around 6:30 (no reservation) on a Friday night and easily found a table. I really like the vibe inside..it's cozy with the wood and brick.  The waitstaff explained how they work things (you order food, it comes out when it's ready) We ordered spinach and artichoke dip, grilled steak skewers, pan seared ahi tuna, fried pickles, meatballs marinara, baked potato croquettes and proscuitto crostini.  The only semi dud was the meatballs (too firm but tasty).  My favorites were (in this order) tuna, steak, proscuitto crostini.  The prices and portions are decent for sharing.  I've been to other tapas places and what I really liked about Dandelion is everything was kind of normal, not too foodie-out-there (i.e. what regular people eat).    YUM!

Dandelion! Not only are your evening dance parties amazing, but your dinner is romantic, delicious, and intimate, you sly dog you. I used to only see dandy as my last stop on a night out and the best part of my bachelorette party, but my eyes have been opened to the remarkable food and ambiance provided by dinner. I've come here twice before going to shows and had amazing times both times. The most recent experience we got to enjoy a half off bottle of wine and some delicious small plates. My husband has small plate anxiety and refuses to share tapas but the serving size at dandelion is okay with him. We shared a couple sides and he got meatballs as his protein while I ordered the short ribs. Both were amazing. Every dish is beautiful and delicious. If you haven't had dinner here yet, you must!

This is my favorite place in charlotte to go to with a large group! You can order the WHOLE menu for under $300 and it easily feeds 15 people. The food is delicious and you get to try a bite of everything! Scallops, lamb, gnocchi, sliders, flatbreads, fried pickles... everything tastes sooo good!

Came here on a Thursday night around 6:30 pm; our party of 3 was seated right away (no reservations needed). We shared 6 dishes family style and left full and satisfied.  Food: My favorites: Pan seared ahi tuna (nothing too unique but it was executed SO well. The tuna was fresh, seared and perfectly rare in the middle and the wasabi aioli, a delicious complement), and the baked potato croquettes (4 perfectly battered and fried baby potatoes served with scallion sour cream). We also tried (in order of preference): the roasted garlic hummus (comes with a pail of pita and a hummus spread, half covered in crispy chickpeas, half in olives), pan seared scallops (comes with 3 scallops on a bed of sweet potato puree -- this dish included everything that I loved, but I wasn't blown away by the execution; it didn't have the nice sear that I was longing for, was slightly overcooked, which didn't go super well with the texture and thickness of the puree), dando brussel sprouts (I wish they were more crispy and carmelized than they were!), and grilled steak skewers (comes with 2 skewers; this one was super underwhelming, very generic).  Service: The service was awesome.   Ambiance: The interior is dimly lit, with exposed brick, and nice big, rustic wooden tables.   Will definitely be back to try out other options on their menu and another round of the ahi tuna and baked potato croquettes!

Went on a quiet Sunday night.  Staff was very attentive and we sat at the picnic table on the second floor.  The room had a cool feel to it, and the lighting was just right.  The food was amazing.  Everything we had was spectacular, especially the sausage bites.  The flat bread pizzas were also very good (we had the duck).  Next time I might go for the $200 have every single tapa in the resturant deal.  Beer selection was great and bartenders were really friendly.  All in all a great addition to Charlotte's uptown restaurants.  I will be going back time and time again.

We came here for brunch so my review is limited to that.  There was so much here that I wanted to order, from huevos rancheros and migas to biscuit sandwiches, but we both set our sights on the monte cristo...ham, turkey, cheese, on French toast with blackberry preserves for dipping.  They were delicious!  Our waitress was also fantastic...very friendly and on the ball.  We needed a quick meal before leaving town, and this did not disappoint.  If I came back to Charlotte, I'd love to try their dinner menu, as it looked equally appealing.  Also, we found the price to be very reasonable for the portion you got, so I'd highly recommend it as an awesome, centrally-located brunch spot in Charlotte.  We were staying at the Marriot, and it took like two minutes to walk there..and they open for brunch at 10 AM, while many other restaurants we looked at didn't open until 11.

WOW! Can I just say hands down some of the best food I have ever had! We ordered the seared ahi tuna, the PEI mussels, and the sweet and spicy green beans. Then to finish it off we got the brownie sundae! It was amazing. It was my first time eating mussels and they were my favorite dish of the night! Service was great! We were seated quickly and the service brought the food out fast and hot. Great place downtown to eat for a good price. Highly recommend for anyone who can't decide what they want to eat. This restaurant allows you to have many different food choices for when you can decide! We will definitely be returning to try more!

Nice ambiance. Lovely restaurant in the nook of west 5th street.  Place - Upon entering the establishment, it has that nice english pub feel, that is inviting with a rack of wooden shoe stretchers on the right hand side. I believe there is another floor of the restaurant.  Food - The fries were delicious! I had ordered a pizza mushroom bread - which I wished I did not order.  The dinner menu looked awesome! Wished we came by for dinner instead, since the lunch menu was a "meh" to me.   Service - The waiter was nice and attentive.  We were able to get seated right away, since we came early - 12:30am, on a Friday - yay us!  Price - It was somewhat pricey, but managable.    Future - I will definitely be back for dinner and try out their scallops.

Our dinner here last night was amazing! They were out of a couple dishes and beers because of the thanksgiving holiday but we understood. Our waiter was nice and gave great service.   We got: -charcuterie board- awesome selection, loved the honey and figs, all the cheeses were our favorite! -fried Brie salad- fried Brie was obviously amazing, the vinaigrette was spot on and the addition of the poached apples went perfectly  -scallops w/corn- soooo good! Wish we had some hot sauce to add but we are hot sauce freaks  -sweet potato gnocchi- taste like thanksgiving dinner in a bite (not a bad thing!) but really it tasted like dressing, gravy, sweet potatoes and everything amazing about thanksgiving all in one -Brussels sprouts- we love Brussels so we had to order these! I really liked them but they were 5% too salty for my taste (but we like less salt on most things)  We will be back next time we're in Charlotte!!

Very nice place. Totally unexpected from the outside. Very tasty drinks and small plates. Mac and cheese is great. Green beans are amazing. Curry turkey meat balls are less than okay. Calamari Is pretty good. The lamb lollipops are amazing and the shrimp and grits were a little disappointing. Service is great

We went for dinner and the food was awesome.  Craft beer list also had a nice variety between local and nonlocal. After dinner, I order the mucho gusto cocktail, which had great flavor, but too much texture (chunks of pineapple) going up my straw for me to finish it. As the Saturday night went on, this place turns into a nighclub. We stayed for a few more hours and enjoyed dancing the night away.   Megan was also great!

I had the pleasure of hanging out with bartender Zy on a slow Sunday night. I was on business and I always ask waiters or bartenders about their fave places. Zy gave me quite a list of restaurants, bars, etc. Dandelion Market is my kind of bar, very cool place with lovely people working. Thanks again Zy.I took her advice as was very glad. I want to come back to dandelion market for brunch and dinner, sounds excellent.

The hostess was welcoming. We were informed a table was being cleared off and then we would be seated but we were starving so we chose the bar. The bartender was great. She was quick and attentive. My girlfriend ordered a mimosa and she said it was great. I ordered a bloody Mary as they have the bloody Mary bar set up. To eat, I ordered the Veggie Poached and it was delicious. I thought the lemon in the hollandaise sauce would over power but I was wrong. Honestly, the best tasting poached eggs with hollandaise sauce I have ever had. My partner ordered the waffle with a side of hash browns. She thought her food was great as well. We live in Atlanta and it is my 1st time in Charlotte. Thank you for the awesome brunch on Valentine's day!

You have to do the brunch Bloody Mary bar!  Given a shot of vodka of your choice you approach a bar that has anything & everything you ever thought of putting in a bloody mary.  Next are the freshly baked home made biscuits.  I could make a meal on these.  So many different mixes & all the trimmings.  Then you get to the menu & the food is great.  A southern flare with twists.  I am a seafood lover & the Crab Cake Benny and the Carolina Shore Omelette are amazing.  The Lamb Lollipops are tasty & well prepared.  Everyone is friendly & the service is fast though we love to lounge at the bar over our meal & that's perfectly okay too.

Whatever it is another night club for kids.  Yes these are 20-something Bud Light drinkers and there are fights and the floors are sticky.  Music is usually the latest pop stuff on the radio.  You get the idea.  So if you are in the mood for exactly this kind of thing then you know what you are getting yourself into here!  :-D

Dandelion is great. What else can I say about a place that has good beer, cheap wine specials and good food. The service here is also pretty good and the food comes out sans problem.   You can order a couple of things for yourself or order for the table and share (I think it's better to share so everyone gets a little bit of something). I'm a big fan of the lamb lollipops, mac and cheese and fries (which come out super crispy).   We went on a Tuesday when they had $15 wine bottle specials and they are well worth it (both the white and reds). Everyone got something a little bit different and had a bite, overall the bill was not astronomical and we all were full by the end. I recommend this place for anyone looking for a bit to eat or just drinks uptown.

The service was absolute crap! We asked our waitress if a dish contained meat she told us "NO" and the item did. Instead of taking the dish away she argued with us.  She then proceeded to point us out to the cook. He looked directly at us and shook his head. Unprofessional is not a strong enough adjective to describe the staff.  Be prepared for small dinner plate portions. If you're on an Ethiopian diet then this is the place for you! The food was edible, but not amazing...... We will not be returning!

i met a few friends here when i was in town on business.  It is a laid back place that has a huge beer and wine list.  The food is all small plate - tapas style.  We had the steak skewers, fried pickles, fries, prosciutto crostinis and calamari (there were 5 of us).  The food was all good - the crostinis were in my opinion the best.  Steak was cooked perfectly.  Overall it was a great place to hang out and catch up.  The bill wasnt too bad after a few rounds of drinks and those plates of tapas.  I will definitely return when i am in Charlotte again.
It looks and feels like a great coffee shop with a great menu and decent selection of  beers.  Great atmosphere and a friendly staff.  Free WiFi.

The atmosphere was great and I thought the decorations and ambiance of the place were gorgeous. We went for dinner and the food was a little overpriced, but it was in downtown so one might expect that. The prices are on their online menu. There were many different plates to choose from to satisfy anyone.   The food itself was very good. I had fried pickles (very good) and the mustard ale cheddar sliders. The only thing I didn't like much about the sliders was that the bread and burger were slightly dry but the overall taste was good. My companion had the market macaroni and cheese and baked potato croquettes and enjoyed both. The horsey aioli served with the fried pickles was amazing.   The service was slow but the food came out fairly quickly. The waitress was friendly and got everything we needed, it just took awhile. It was quite loud but not enough to make me want to leave.   Overall, I would go back. I enjoyed the food and atmosphere very much. I am not of drinking age, but they had a large selection of alcohol for those who are. I didn't end up ordering it, but dessert is offered of you ask the waitress what they have. I'd say give this place a try!  One thing I thought was really neat that I have never seen before was the option of getting one of everything on the menu if you have a large group. It was $275 I believe and would be a lot of food as the dinner menu is pretty big. So if you have a large group and want to pass around and try everything, the option is there. I would probably call ahead for that anyway though. This is on the bottom of the menu but I haven't done this myself.

First off, Dandelion Market has great atmosphere. They serve food Tapas style (small plates). I like their Red Pepper Artichoke Dip, Fried Calamari and Seared Ahi Tuna. The Grilled Lamb Lollipops are also popular. Dandelion Market has a good variety of beers. It is a great place to have a team dinner. I like the second floor for that.

Came for an early dinner, and it did not disappoint. The bartender/server was friendly and helped me make some selections off the menu. Chicken wings were delicious; sweet flavor and moist. The shrimp&grits was also pretty good, came with 2 decently sized shrimp, good flavor. The place was a bit loud, but only cause there was a large group of people drunkenly shouting amongst each other.   The server was really nice too! Recommended some solid beers and made decent conversation.

Two Words: Lamb Lolipops. WOWza. Definitely licked my plate.  I haven't had anything off the menu that I wouldn't enthusiastically order again. This place is awesome--from the cozy downstairs bar area to the hip upstairs (equipped with live DJ on weekends, and a dancefloor)... this place has everything--great food, great bar, great atmosphere. Pricey, but awesome to go with a group or on a date!

Tried Dandelion Market last night, and like other reviewers, was really impressed! Great addition to Charlotte - lots of original menu items at reasonable prices and a great beer list.   We tried several of the Apps - I loved the fondue and fried artichokes, never seen those before and in the South we fry it all, so why not??   They also have a great beer selection - found a new favorite, in fact. If you like Allagash, try their Witterkirke - I've never seen it on a menu before and I'm heading to Total Wine to look for some for my fridge!   We were upstairs, which was getting crowded with after work peeps, by the time we left (9ish) it was packed! Our server was very attentive to our large group and the food came out really fast!  Good to see a newer place doing so well! Check it out, you won't be disappointed!

So I totally can't vouch for the food at this place, but let me tell you...this is the place to be if you're looking for some casual Saturday night dancing to good music while the drinks are flowing.  We got there around 11:30ish.  The bar downstairs was pretty dead at first, which was perfect.  That means no line to wait for drinks.  We got our drinks and went upstairs, where everyone was hanging out and dancing.  All of the bartenders were really friendly and were pretty fast in making the drinks.  They also did a great job with making good drinks super fast, so you never had to wait too long to get served.  The music was a ton of fun.  All songs that you can sing along to.  Even though I wasn't on the hunt, there were a TON of cute guys here.  To all the single ladies, this is the place you want to be on a Saturday night.  The crowd was fun, not rough.  Certainly a place you can get hit on buy a guy and score a few free drinks.  Dandelion seems to have done a great job as a crossover day-restaurant/night-bar.  Based on some of the other Yelp reviews, I'll have to come back here sober and try the food.

I'm glad they offer vegan options, although I wish they would state them on the regular menu instead of making you ask for a special tiny menu. It's a bit awkward. Also awkward, was getting my own plates, since they all had to be modified to be made vegan, instead of sharing with my friends. Of course, I guess that is because of the restaurant style, not this particular restaurant. Obviously I'd go to an all-vegan small plates place if I had the choice! Anyways, on to the food. I had the vegan versions of the hummus and pita, black bean sliders, and green beans. It was way too much food, even though they suggested 3 plates per person. But it was all very good! I especially liked the flavor of the sliders. The drinks were good too, and our server was great. All in all, not worth the money, but the food was good.

In the Queen City for a reunion of sorts, Ole-Peeps celebrating their youth of many moons past...6 of us found our way to this establishment mid-evening, given various personalities/appetites we settled on the "One of Everything" menu....multiple bottles of Cava and other vino selections...plates were quick form the oven to the table, all were tasty as well as the juice...Neat spot by the old Ivey's Dept Store...another memory of an era of many moons ago....Enjoy!

We tried Dandelion Market again, but for dinner and it was just as good! They have tapas style dishes for dinner, but everything we tried tasted amazing! - the shrimp and grits, sweet potato gnocchi, and prosciutto delisting were among our favorites. We also got a brownie with ice cream for dessert that was soft and warm, it was a great meal.
Had the mussels, ducksalad, southern cap rear, calamari, scallops and lamb lollipops. All amazing!! Would recommend and come again when I'm back in Charlotte!

Love, love, LOVE this place! Came here for the first time today for brunch. We don't come to Charlotte much, but stopping here will be a must from now on!  I had (the world's best) grilled cheese and tomato soup while my hubby had the Monte Carlo. Both were superb! A cozy little restaurant.... Not too crowded, with just the right vibe. Will definitely return! :)
Awesome food and bar selections! A long wait but that's because everyone wants in! The customer service was pretty good. She was definitely busy but very efficient and personable!

Honestly the juevos rancheros was horrible. It should really be called juevos diarehheros, because it look liked someone shitted in a skillet, put an egg on it and fried the whole thing. I can't believe the chef honestly had this item on the menu. Please order it, you shall be pleasantly surprised.

Great stop on a lazy Sunday downtown. Went in for lunch, thinking maybe a salad or something light and ended up eating two eggs, sausage and fruit (life's about balance, baby). The food was outstanding. The service was a solid B+ and would've been better if my server had offered to refill my drink, which ran dry. Outside of that, things were great. Definitely worth a trip.

I'm going to be honest and admit I've been avoiding trying their food, even though so many people have told me how good it is and my fellow Yelpers are all in agreement that the food is delicious. My issue is that I've only been to Dandy when its after 12am and when I'm not really looking for a gourmet meal if you know what I mean...  I am also going to admit that my fears were unfounded. I went at 11am on a Sunday and the floors were not still sticky, there were no errant beer bottles rolling around, and there was no lingering sweat/stale beer smell in the air. I ordered a coffee to start (blue laws are the bane of my existence) and it came with a cute mini milk bottle full of cream. Refills were frequent and the coffee was on par with other brunch places in the area. I was pleasantly surprised when they brought over mini biscuits with apple butter and jam. The biscuits were a little overcooked but honestly any place that gives you free carbs as an appetizer is a winner in my book. I ended up ordering the migas as my meal because I can never have enough Mexican food in my life. The eggs were well cooked and spiced well. I was a bit confused on how they wanted me to eat them - as a taco? as a burrito? as nachos? I ended up eating them as scrambled eggs and ate the tortillas on the side. Overall, I definitely recommend Dandelion as a good option for brunch when you don't feel like waiting for a table at Zada Janes. I can't wait to go back and try their dinner/lunch menu as it looked delicious!

This place popped up on one of my searches so I decided to get a large group together for dinner. Some people mentioned it was known for brunch and the club upstairs but after seeing all the food pictures I decided to ignore popular belief and go with my gut.   Intuition served me right. The food was amazing!!! The scallops were cooked to perfection accompanied by some sort of pur√©e that really brought together all the flavors. The lamp pops were insane and with just a touch of sweetness - oh and the cherries on the side of the plates were incredible. I wasn't terribly impressed with the Brussels sprouts - they could use a revamping but other than that it was Devine.

How can anyone go wrong with small plates to share and $25 bottles of wine. I am in!!! I love this place. Everything is always excellent and fresh and the staff are always so friendly and positive.   Shrimp and grits, southern fried caprese, fried pickles, ahi tuna.... yea take me back, asap!

This is a great spot for an afternoon drink while "bar officing" or an evening of fun noise, great tapas, and a vibrant crowd!  I live in the neighborhood and came here last night after being ignored for five minutes at a highly rated neighboring restaurant.   Dandelion never fails to offer attentive and friendly service at the bar - my absolute favorite tapas dish is the cherry lamb lollipops.  The saltiness of the lamb combined with the sweet cherry sauce and six divine little cherries on the side makes me happy!  They have a nice selection of local beer, a full bar, and, again, friendly people!

I know this place is also a nightclub I think but my review is based strictly on my visit here during lunch.  I found the menu to be full of healthy selections and refreshing, light lunches.  I had the Boars Head turkey sandwich on rye bread with a spinach salad for the side.  The sandwich came with the basics, tomato, lettuce and light mayo.  Nothing to write home about really regarding the sandwich but something to note is that it was a decent portion size and fresh, so no complaints.  The side salad was fine, a little overdone with the vinaigrette dressing and no real accouterments in the salad, strictly spinach leaves.  It was still fine.  I will definitely be back to try some of the other menu options soon :)

Visiting Charlotte for the week-came here on a Sunday for brunch. Ordered the "prosciutto benny" which was delicious. Best part about this restaurant is the atmosphere and the homemade biscuits with jelly/jam. Would highly recommend.

Went for the first time for Sunday brunch and had a fantastic time upstairs!  Although a little chilly, we quickly warmed up with hot coffee and biscuits and cornbread served as soon as we were seated.  The build-your-own Bloody Mary bar was incredibly creative and fun!  We spent two hours with friends just enjoying each other's creations!  The food was awesome (the ham and cheese omelette was melt-in-your-mouth!  Will definitely be going again soon.

The food here is amazing. We always order several small plates to share. Most of what we ordered was fantastic. Of course, as with most tapas places, I think that the pricing is high for the amount on the plate. But it's very unique and so close to the bell theatre that it's a great place to go before the theatre.

We dinned 2/3/15  Atmosphere: Restaurant is tucked away on a street. We almost passed it! When you walk in, it's extremely dark and really loud. BUT we were siting next to a table of 10. Our waitress was kind, but was far and between when checking on us.   Food: A great range of tapas food. From vegetarian, sea and meat. It's hard to pin point what stood out because we ordered at least 15 different plates. But personally the Prosciutto Crostini sticks out. ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC. It was a bold punch of flavors. That just melts in your mouth. I would go back JUST to eat this. We stuck with a bottle of wine and skipped deserts.  Overall: Would I return? Maybe at lunch if it was better lit? And was able to have a conversation with my colleagues. Also for the crostini. Wasn't blown away.

DANDY! Why have I not reviewed you yet?   This is a favorite among my coworkers and I, what with the close proximity to our restaurant, the amazing food served til midnight, and $3 Pint Night. The small plates are perfect to split, or to just order 4 and eat them by yourself as I have been known to do. The beer cheese fondue and fried artichokes cannot be beat.   I usually stay away from the upstairs, especially on weekends, as it does tend to get crowded and douche-y. (And really guys, $3 craft pints and you just got a Miller Lite? Really?) They usually play good music, but I'm just not a can-of-sardines, beer-spilled-on-you person. Nah, I'm really more of a downstairs type of girl. Downstairs is pretty awesome though.

Caught up with a friend and had a quick dinner on a Tuesday night. It had a lot of people there watching the game and socializing, which gave it a nice casual feel. The room itself was on the dark side which made it intimate but contrasted the noise of the crowd. It's a small plate format, so I ordered the lamb lollipops and the brussel sprouts which I HIGHLY recommend. The portions were decent but definitely on the pricier side.

Wandered into the Dandelion after a long flight from Seattle to Charlotte, and was pleasantly surprised by the place.  Looks like most other Irish (or pseudo-Irish) bars, but the gent behind the bar had a rather authentic accent, which is usually a decent sign of things to come.  I had wandered in during happy hour, which I discovered is an excellent time to join the festivities, since they have $3 drafts - any beer.  I tried a local Amber by Birdsong, then a traditional Belgian dark/sour called Klokke Roeland.  Both beers were great buys for the price.  As to food, I ordered fried pickles (being in the South, that's a must), some fries, and their Mustard Ale Cheddar sliders.  The servings were GIGANTIC - definitely not what I had expected from a tapas menu, and could easily have served three people, not just one or two.  The fried pickles were pretty good, but the dipping sauce made up for the lack of "dilliness" that I like in my pickles.  The fries were amazing, but I couldn't even make a dent in the serving.  But the sliders.  Oh.  My.  God.  The bacon on them was awesome, they weren't over-cheesed like so many burgers can be, and the meat on them was so juicy.  Plus, they were HUGE...I managed to down one and a half, which is why I couldn't dent the fries.  Walked out with a bill under $30, which is rare when traveling and heading out for a dinner on the town.  Would highly recommend the place for anyone looking for tapas-plus.
Ambience is great, food is Meh.. nothing out of this world except for the fried calamari that was seasoned and fried to perfection!

Once again, thank you YELP!  We arrived around 7pm on a Friday night so it wasn't crazy. Ate downstairs which was perfect! I think that my wife and I both said "I like the feel of this place" more than once.  Great craft beer selection on tap. I don' t think they had any macro crap coming out of the pipes.  This place specializes in small plates. Our waiter was great and suggested 3-4 if looking for dinner x2.  VERY difficult to decide.   We had the cheese board, stuffed poblano pepper.  These were both repeatable offenses.  I had read about the lobster Mac n cheese. Our waiter mentioned it was gone but later returned informing us they had 3 in the kitchen. We grabbed one. WOW!  Lots of lobster, very creamy, and only $3 more than regular mac? YES PLEASE!    When we return, it will have to be on $3 draft night!

1. Go here for the bar... great drinks and good choice of beer and wine. This area saves Dandelion Market from being downgraded to a two star...  2. The food menu is a tapas approach with a wide variety of food.  3. The downer... the food was simply bland.      - The shrimp bruschetta was a complete myeh... come on chef, dare to present some unique flavors!!!     - The black beans sliders look great but, again, a flavorless mass of myeh!     - The red pepper dip was pretty decent but lacked zing! Whenever I start looking for sauces to add to a dish that means that nothing is baked into the original recipe.  A caveat... the other dishes may be simply awesome and we just happened upon the three items that were myeh... please prove me wrong with the other dishes.  4. Service is well done but the young lady who seated us was a bit grouchy... after we sat down we both laughed and told her, under our breath, Have a Nice Day!!!

This is a must go to if you are in Charlotte, NC.  I was taken here for a business dinner and we ordered "everything on the menu" literally.  It was so awesome I had to make a stop when I came back into town.  This time we just sat at the bar, a much smaller group, and we each ordered 2 items to share and a flat bread.  It was plenty of food.  I also love the beer selection and the bartender was really awesome!  I will keep going back. :)
Dandelion is one of my go to places to eat and drink in Uptown. I love the diverse options for food and the rotating beer list. Every time I'm there the staff is friendly and staff.

My favorite go to! Service is friendly and professional. The food is unbelievable!! I think we have tried most everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. They change up the menu at times to reflect what's in season. Wish I could give this place 10 stars!

Now, I hardly ever review on Yelp. I just stalk around. But Dandelion Market gave me no choice. On vacation in Charlotte from Richmond, Virginia my boyfriend and I chose this restaurant spend our three-year anniversary evening at based on Yelp reviews. For a Monday night there was a good amount of people present and the atmosphere is lovely. Compared to restaurants in Richmond that offers small plates, this plates beats them all. We had the sweet and spicy green beans, which were sweet, sticky, and delicious. The fried pickles with horse radish aioli which were excellently fried, the Brussels sprouts which were extremely flavorful and the pomme frites which were incredibly crispy and came with a delicious house made ketchup and we shared the ghiradelli salted caramel brownie sundae which was huge and only $6!!! The music is very tasteful, and our waitress Kylie was so attentive and sweet. 100% recommend this place if you're looking for a casual nice night out. Thank you Dandelion Market for topping off our vacation.

Dinner menu is always relish. Drinks are tasty. Servers and bartenders are always friendly. Lunch menu feels like it's lacking the same amazingness as the dinner menu. Got a weird piece of ahi tuna but the bartender took it off my tab.

Went back to Dandelion this weekend, and the food was superb yet again. I recommend the steak kabobs, red pepper / artichoke dip, stuffed poblano, and chicken remoulade. I have my heart set on trying the mac and cheese, but that will have to wait til next time!
Hands down some of the best food I've had in awhile! The Pinot Grigio is delicious also!

One of the best tapas places around.  The entire menu is stellar- but the highlights for me were the rich, smoky mac & cheese, the outrageously flavorful sweet and spicy green beans and steak Skewers.  Our group tried 15+ samplings. Almost all plates were enough to share between 3-4 people, though the skewers are made for two.  Food came out, as ready, at staggered times and was always quick and fresh.   Nice bar selection- drinks were hearty with a heavy pour :)

Great brunch on Sunday mornings. I love the food but the service is awful. Food took a long time and then the woman beside me had celiac and ordered gluten free waffles and was served regular waffles, when she asked the server, she said she was not sure if she had the correct waffles. After which they never addressed the problem. The manager came out and literally threw the waffles on the table without apologizing. The girl even stated that she was not upset about the mix up but the way it was handled.

My boyfriend used my corporate discount to buy a coupon to take me out to dinner while he was in town :) He's such a Romantic....  We were there on a Sunday night and were joined by four? other people. This made me appreciate the social nature of our waitress who I do believe I went to highschool with (I hope my super cute boyfriend didn't make her jealous).   As for the food, small plates were perfect bc I like EVERYTHING. We had the antipasto, the cheese plate, and the cucumber salad. The antipasto was pepperoni, Spanish chorizo (the hard kind), soppressata(?), and olives. The cheese plate was a 3 out of 4, but I was happy to find one of them was from Sheep's milk!  They had a pretty good beer selection, and I did really like the interior.. Exposed brick walls, and dark woods... Not what I originally envisioned for a place called the Dandelion Market.
Amazing affordable wholesome food! We loved the grilled steak skewers and prosciutto crostini. Yum!
Great brunch menu. Got the Carolina Shore omelet - amazing. Great game day atmosphere and service.

I have been a long time advocate for Dandelion Market, not only for their menu but the ambiance of the split level restaurant and bar. After making AND confirming reservations for a party of 7 for a bachelorette party, your staff member knew and confirmed 7 did not meet the 8 minimum requirement and confirmed the reservation anyways. We show up, excited (keep in mind, there are many other places we could have chosen to go and we chose your restaurant) and ready to start a good night, only to be greeted with a questioning of our reservations and absolutely no apology or concern from your manager that there was a blatant mix up. Unbelievable! I love this restaurant and this was completely baffling to me. Such poor customer service. Poor management. And with no concern to help adjust the situation. I, myself, have recommended and/or had my own reservations for parties here. I will not be taking my service here again for gatherings and will not be recommending this as a staple visit for anyone in downtown Charlotte. Very disappointed from this experience and I hope management can handle situations like this in a better way, in the future. Better training is needed all around.
Food is great, atmosphere fantastic, service could be better.   Still a great regular spot in uptown for drinks and small plates

I love this place. Its such an amazing vibe and reminds me of a few places back home. A lot of cheap small plates which are all amazing. We had the noki and cheese plate and were amazed on how well it was. I would recommend anyone to come check this place out.

The food was incredible! The lamp lollipops alone were worth the 45 minute wait. Delicious! We also got steak skewers, Mac and cheese, and fried pickles. A medley of awesome flavors and I'm looking forward to going back!

Everything about this place is great.  Great food, great service and great beer selection.  The small plates were excellent and great for sharing.  Would definitely recommend to anyone in or traveling to Charlotte.  Especially great service from Lyndsey!

When you don't know where to eat, and what you want to eat. Two words: Dandelion Market. When you fancy some good little bites, and you don't want to hurt your wallet. Two words: Dandelion Market. Another win in my book. Two words: Dandelion Market.  - BBQ Short Rib: Oh...my...goodness. ($12.00) - Chicken wings ($6.00) - Calamari: Crispy and delish. ($9.00) - Fried pickles: A bit over cooked. ($6.50) - Gnocchi. Very good. ($8.50) - Ahi Tuna. Must try. ($13.00) - Steak Skewers. Seriously Yummy. ($12.50) - Pommes Frites. ( $6.00)  The food/drinks were presented to us by very friendly staff. Over all great experience. Very highly recommended for groups who like to share or individuals who like to try food in small quantities.   Don't put it off any longer, and giveDandelion Market a try.  Four and Half Yelps
Still a good fall back place when all other places are either closed or just too busy and perfect for Sunday brunch, but I still find their food a bit pricey for what you get.

My fiance and I went here for dinner on a Tuesday night and absolutely loved it! The food was excellent (mussels, calamari, ahi tuna, mushrooms and fried pickles), the drinks were great and our server, Amanda, was awesome I would definitely recommend DM and can't wait to go back!

LOVE this place. Everything about it. The service, the atmosphere, the food - everything was awesome. Katie H. was our server and she was incredibly friendly, knew a lot about the menu and was eager to give recommendations on both beer and food. My friend and I split the mussels and they were so amazing. The sauce was to die for! So much so that when we got fried pickles, we ended up dipping them in the sauce from the mussels instead of the sauce they came in. I live in Atlanta and was just visiting Charlotte but I know I will be visiting this place again next time I'm in town. And I'll definitely be asking for Katie H.!

It was my anniversary, and I wanted to try somewhere new.  Luckily, I had a Groupon for this place and had been wanting to try it for some time.  The atmosphere was dark and intimate and the food was AMAZING!  Too bad I could barely converse with my partner across the table.  We came here on a Tuesday, and it was not terribly busy.  However, there was a large table of about 10 people here, and the noise was deafening.  We started off sitting right next to that table, but luckily we were able to move.  Since the downstairs area is relatively small, we couldn't move that far away.  Even at the new table, it was still pretty loud, but we could actually hear each other talk.    Anyway, that was the only negative.  Now - on with the positive.  They have a great selection of beers there, and on Tuesdays their bottles of wine are only $15!!  We had beer and decided to get four plates between the two of us.  We started off with the calamari, which was a surprisingly big portion for a "small" plate.  The calamari tasted fresh, the batter was light, crispy, and flavorful (almost like a light tempura batter).  This was served with a lemon aoli, which I thought had a great garlic flavor.  I really enjoyed this dish  After that came pan seared Ahi tuna.  It was perfectly cooked rare, and it tasted like it had never been frozen.  On the side is a wasabi aoli and sweet chili sauce.  Now, I do NOT like horseradish at all, which makes wasabi pretty much a deal breaker if even a little bit comes into contact with my food.  I actually enjoyed the aoli, which had only a hint of wasabi.  The chili sauce was awesomely flavorful and really complemented the aoli.  Very delicious!  The portion size was pretty decent for the price.  Next came the lamb lollipops and the autumn gnocchi.  These two items stole the show!  The lamb was very tender, and not overly seasoned.  The cherry sauce served with it was amazing, and it very much complemented the lamb.  Oh, and the gnocchi - HEAVENLY!  The squash was caramelized perfectly, and the dumplings themselves were tender.  The gnocchi was the best I've ever had.    Our server was friendly and attentive as well.  If it had not been so loud in there, I would have enjoyed the atmosphere a little more.  However, I can say that I greatly disliked the chairs there.  I have short legs, and I had to sit on end of the seat so my feet could touch the floor.  Next time I might have to try the plush-looking bar stools.  I am definitely coming back here again.  I give the food 5 stars for sure.  Overall, I'd rate it about 4.5 stars total.

I had been in the mood for grilled chicken wings all week and it's hard to find a restaurant that serves grilled wings. They're usually fried and greasy! After learning that the Dandelion Market had phenomenal GRILLED wings, I had to give it a try!   They recommended two meals per person because they are smaller plates for sharing. I ordered the fruit-n-nut salad. It had poached apples and pears, cranberries, figs, candied pecans, point reyes bleu cheese, mixed greens, citrus white balsamic and olive oil. I had them switch the blue cheese with goat cheese. My friend ordered the Mediterranean Trio and DANG...it was good! The trio had lemon garlic hummus, sun dried tomato tapenade, tabbouleh and pitas.
