My wings came out after the salad and they were everything I hoped for and more. They were PERFECT! Crispy, sweet, spicy and juicy! My friend also ordered the black bean sliders and said they were the best vegetarian black bean sliders she's ever had.   I also had breakfast there a couple weeks back and I can't wait to go back again. I can't believe it's taken me this long to try this place out.I ordered the Dando veggie omelet with a side of bacon. The omelet had havarti cheese, tomatoes, peppers and onion. I love an omelet full of flavor and this one hit the spot. Their coffee was PERFECT. It tasted like French press.   My waitresses were super nice BOTH times and it's such a fun environment. The decor is dark and rustic. I love the lighting and the brick walls. You can sit upstairs or downstairs!

The best thing about Dandelion is Sidy. That is besides the beer and food. Sidy is my favorite bartender in all if Charlotte. I love going to a place and the staff is happy to see me, knows my name and is quick to keep my glass filled.   The food is also quite good but will admit, I usually only go for drinks once or twice a month. Tapas is served, which is good for sharing but can really drive up your bill if you get hungry.   Since I'm a happy hourer, I'm usually out the door before the Uptown madness starts.  But from what I hear, it's a good place to meet the young and beautiful after dark.

Great Snack size meals. Perfect for a beer and snack. Visited the place while in town, and was here for dinner. Loved the beer collection. The food size is small but tastes so good. Loved the dishes we ordered. A must visit place if you are in downtown and hungry.

I love a tapas place as I often travel alone and these places allow me to add more variety to my meal. I was in the Queen City on business and my Yelp Mobile App led me here.  I liked this place enough to visit more than once.   This place has a nice dark pub atmosphere.  It was so dark that I actually needed to use the flashlight on my phone a time or two to see the menu.  To me the emphasis seems to be on the bar as opposed to the restaurant.  The tables actually look uncomfortable.  One of my visits was on a Monday night and $3 drafts were featured.  Every brew was #3 and that means about twenty taps.  That's a great deal and at 7:30 the place was packed.  The beer list is decent and well thought out.  It's not Flying Saucer crazy big but it's broad enough to satisfy most beer folks.  They also have a short list of specialty cocktails that they execute beautifully. The Cucumber Mint Mojito was excellent.  By the way, the bartenders here are excellent and customer service was never a problem.  The first tapa I ordered was the BAKED POTATO CROQUETTES - $6 that came with aged cheddar, Beeler's bacon and scallion cream. They arrived quickly and were plated beautifully.  They were good but not great.  None of the flavors had enough intensity to really tingle my taste buds.  They are missing something and the chef needs to think that through.  Next up was SAUSAGE STUFFED POBLANO PEPPER - $8 with Italian sausage, cheese, and house made crema.  Now this was more like it.  This dish was bursting with flavors that melded together perfectly.  I enjoyed every morsel.  Finally, on another visit, I tried the MUSTARD ALE CHEDDAR SLIDERS - $9 with Beeler's bacon and  l&t.  What was inside the bun was one of the best sliders I have ever tasted.  It was juicy, perfectly seasoned deliciousness.  Unfortunately the bun spoiled what could have been an amazing plate.  First it was cold which is totally unacceptable and second it was slightly dry.  What a shame. The bun should have been fresh and grilled.  One again this was a miss by the chef.  I want to love this place and it has a lot going for it. The atmosphere and the beers are right on.  The menu looks fantastic but the execution was flawed with two dishes I tried.  It's time for some attention to detail.  I can sense greatness but we're not quite there yet.

The website makes this place appear a lot larger than it actually is - at least on the first floor. My friend called and asked if we needed reservations she was told no but when we got there we had about a 10 min wait for a table . I'm learning to just make reservations whenever I go out to any semi popular restaurant in Charlotte even the chain restaurants. We were seated near the bar and brought water and shot glasses ... like seriously I guess the water "glasses" go with the ambiance but they were literally the size of a large shot glass... Since  I would have looked like an idiot putting a straw into a shot glass I decided on a glass of white wine...  I prefer to drink my nonalcoholic beverages with a straw .. alcohol kills germs right .... I'm a huge fan of tapas or small plates because I get to sample pretty much everything, I'm not into the whole sharing thing so I ordered 3 small plates for myself.  I tried the spinach and goat cheese salad .. wow this was pretty good so simple yet so good. They gave a generous amount of spinach with pine nuts, and a scoop of goat cheese on top. Next I had the grilled lamb lollipops so yummy they were also covered in the same vinaigrette as my salad , and finally the sliders  - basically a cheese burger with some fancy bacon . Both the chops and sliders only had two servings so unless it's just two people I would either order two or get something else if you're planning on sharing with a group.  Overall the food was pretty good my friends tried the calamari, and the shrimp and grits ... and whoa who knew that you could fry grits  into the shape of little cubes.. They had an interesting taste but a strange presentation at least to me. I'm not a big fan of shrimp and grits but my friend said they were delicious (only two shrimps tho...)  I'm not sure what's upstairs I'm hoping more tables b/c there isn't a lot of room downstairs and it's super dark in there. I like this place and would be interested in coming back from brunch .   Parking - I parked in the deck over on 6th street I think there is another deck down 5th maybe .. but the walk from the 6th street deck (5 bucks) wasn't bad.

I ate here twice in one weekend and now, I don't want to go anywhere else. The service and the food are great. My favorite is the Bloody Mary bar on the weekends.  They set the bar up downstairs, give you your vodka and let you make your own. They have everything you will need for the perfect Bloody Mary. The music that they play is also great. I am always a fan of establishments that don't play mainstream music. I thoroughly enjoy myself here.

We went on a Friday for dinner and everything was excellent? The server recommended 3 plates each. We decided to split three which was a wise choice as they were huge! Great service and atmosphere we will definitely be back.

This was a great find, thanks to a local waitress from Mac's Speedway. Monday happened to be having $3 beer specials, which never hurts for 4 guys. They typically recommend 2-3 plates per person, depending on which you order.  We ended up getting a mix of 12 total, which turned out to be great.  Prosciutto Crostini....amazing! Spinach & Goat cheese salad.....needed some greens in our diet, but tasty Surf & Turf...scallops and pulled pork were both very flavorful, great dish Salmon cakes.....another tasty dish Crab cakes....I thought these were better than the salmon cakes, great flavor Sliders....sliders with bacon? enough said, delicious Ribs....wet ribs with a nice amount of meat on each, solid dish Stuffed Poblano Pepper...might have been my favorite dish of the night and very filling Mac & Cheese...very creamy and you get that hint of smoked pepper  I am drawing a blank of the last few, but I think we doubled up on 1 or 2 of the ones I mentioned.  Service was also good and the waiter was helpful in recommending dishes.

Solid 4 stars for the food itself.  Service was a little lacking though.  The brunch menu was delightful.  I ordered the grilled cheese and it was made from Tillamook Cheese!!!  I'd recognize that taste anywhere.  Took me back to the grilled cheese sandwiches I used to make myself when I was growing up on the West Coast.  Will probably be back to try other items on the menu.

Food and service were very good. Loved the layout and decor. For tapas, I feel that the portions were generous. There were two of us and four plates was more than enough. We really enjoyed the short ribs, sliders and sweet potato gnocchi. We went on a Friday evening around 6PM and were only one of three tables (plus a few people sitting at the bar). Was surprised that there were not more people. Would highly recommend.

Came here for lunch with coworkers.  The lunch menu is very, very, very different.  It's almost like a Boar's Head Deli lunch menu.  Basically there are a limited variety of sandwiches or burgers, two soups, and maybe three salads.  The portions are much more generous for the price compared to dinner, but I wouldn't call them big.  With a group of 10, we were able to be seated on one table in short order, and the location still never filled up around us.  There was quite a bit of disorganization around ordering, but the server was sweet and patient, splitting the checks automatically and with a perfect recollection.  The orders came out fairly scattered, with two orders arriving much later than the first round.  All told, it took us just about 90 minutes to have lunch, given this awkward delay; not bad for 10 people, but seems like it could have been faster given how empty the place was.  Everyone seemed satisfied with their orders, good flavor and fresh food.  The drinks kept being replenished automatically.  I would suggest that if you order the grilled cheese, get a side of something--fries, a salad, or sliders--to go with, as that meal is a smaller portion than the rest of the options, even with the soup.  Dandelion Market, you've now got a daytime win under your belt, in my book.  I'd definitely come back here for a work lunch.

Great, innovative food, friendly staff, and a great drink selection in a tapas/small plate setting. The food is always good and the service is knowledgeable about selections. Another perk is the great location in Uptown Charlotte.

Small but cool restaurant uptown. The food is served tapas-style, and I got a series of sides including the zucchini ribbon pasta, dando Brussels sprouts, and the veggie skewers. Those three sides were enough to make a light meal for me. The zucchini ribbon pasta was probably my favorite, as I did not love the bacon in the Brussels sprouts. I liked the trendy, laid back vide of this place. Definitely a good place to come with friends so you can split a bunch of dishes.
This is an absolute must stop if you are out and about in Charlotte.  The beer selection is expansive, the menu is diverse and tasty and the service is always quite good.  I will be back.
I love this place and we come here a lot. The service here is great and I haven't tried one small plate I haven't liked yet. Definitely get the sweet potato gnocchi's

I'm not sure what it is with NC and using tons of seafood in their dishes, but I like it.  I got the Carolina Shore omelette and it was stuffed with visible chunks of lump crab, scallop, and prawn.  I got the hollandaise on the side, which made it a lot less heavy.  I still couldn't finish it, but I tried to pick out all the seafood.  The hash browns are definitely home fries, but they're crispy and tasty so no complaints there.  The bread basket options in the beginning are also pretty awesome.  Very impressed with Charlotte's food offerings.

Okay, to be totally fair, I would give this place another half star if Yelp let me. Also, I've been to as many gastropubs in California as my waistline will allow, so I don't mean to discourage the fledgling gastropub scene here in Charlotte. But, I can't help but compare.  The good:  The bartenders on the first floor are always *phenomenal* and the mixed cocktails they serve are innovative and well-crafted. Absolutely try the fig cocktail, which is a great unisex drink: fairly sweet for the girls, but full-bodied and not overly sugary for the guys.   Atmosphere is warm and inviting.  Some of the plates are out of this world: standard pub fare like chicken wings have that extra zip from whatever seasoning they use. Also, you MUST try the ribs and the sausage-stuffed pepper. Foodie heaven. Lamb lollipops are also wonderful.  The bad:  The food is not as well-thought-out as it should be, considering this place's fame and what they're trying to accomplish. The bruschetta is only toasted on one side, making it soft on the top of your tongue, but hard and crunchy on the top of your palette. The black bean sliders should be delicious, but the rather bready and unremarkable buns they serve them on are very distracting to the taste buds.  Full service is slow and the servers are not very knowledgeable about the food that's being ordered. I know that good help can be hard to find, but Dandelion Market needs to step up the game with its waitstaff if it wants to have the best gastropub in town. Also, having to wait a long time for your food is silly in a place like this. You have one of the most popular joints in town, put more people in the kitchen!

I've been here several time. But today I decided to leave a review because of the amazing server we had today. Her name is Brooke! SHE IS AMAZING, very polite, she would check on ya regularly but without making us feel pressured. It was my sisters birthday and she made sure to recognize it with shots and a cake.  Food wise... We ordered like 7 different tapas, which all of them were amazing: wings, mussels, flatbread, calamari, chorizo cheese dip, deviled eggs... Great environment, good music (you can have a conversation without screaming).
Brunch was decent. The bloody Mary's are great! Will definitely return to try the dinner/night scene.

Excellent restaurant, small plates cheap prices allows you too try many dishes. I love it!!! We had the  jalape√±o Sarot Cha eggs, meat and cheese board followed by the Italian stuffed poblano pepper, and finished with the short ribs and washed down with the not your fathers root beer.  Thanks Chelsea for serving us! You were great !

dandelion! We all loved everything we tried- even the sweet potato gnocchi (which reminds you of stuffing at Thanksgiving). We had the fig & goat cheese crostinis, the beef short rib, the baked mac 'n cheese (extra delish), the calamari, and the cheese charcuterie plate. Great service too!

Nom nom. Came here for brunch and the low country skillet and crab cake benedict were on fleek. Small portions, but satisfying. Very hip and trendy restaurant. Dinner is tapas style and not as good as the brunch menu. They also have a Bloody Mary bar.

Great experience.  Smaller than I thought (maybe theres a dining room in the back?)  Great beer selection and food variety/quality/preparation was on point. I had the raved about lamb chop lollypops (get the full order not the half).  Staff was pleasant, quick and very accommodating (needed to make a show).  I'll definately put this on my Charlotte list!

I experienced the "bar" version of this place on Saturday night.   Man, was it packed.  It did have a pretty cool vibe to it, but it was hard to enjoy it when we were all standing shoulder to shoulder and my butt got grabbed a couple times (by people you don't want to grab your butt)....  I'm sure it was an accidental "hey, how's it going?"  but it made me feel a bit dirty.  Crowd aside, we did not even attempt to get drinks at the bar since it would have taken a parting of the red sea to get to... plus to fight the other thirsty patrons once you got to the front.  With all the people on the 2nd floor, the floor started to feel like it was bouncing at times... we went downstairs to escape the craziness and hung out on the fringes near the kitchen.  Don't know how much the cover was for guys since a friend of ours had passes for all of us... but there was a long line outside to get inside..... I may have felt cheated if I actually paid the cover.  Probably will give this place another chance - maybe it was just a bad night for me :(

Dropped in for lunch today and had a delicious meal.  I ordered the boss sandwich, fries (per our server's recommendation) and a soda.  The sandwich was delicious, had a great flavor too it and the dressing was awesome. The bread was fresh and better that what I'm used to. And it was a nice, big portion. The fries were equally addictive and needless to say I had people picking them off my plate.  The service was great and the decor is cool. I could definitely see myself coming back for dinner or for a few beers.   The prices weren't bad either. My only complaint is that we didn't come for dinner. From the looks of the dinner menu they have even better options at dinner time. We'll definitely come back.

We are visiting from out-of-state and decided to dine here for dinner since this place had good reviews and our hotel was only a few blocks away. When we arrived, the hostess brought us to a table upstairs even though the lively brightly lit bottom floor was mostly empty. The upstairs is VERY DIM that we had to use our cell phone flashlights just to read the menu! TIP: If possible, you may want to request a seat downstairs instead.  We ordered (in order of our favorites):   1. Patatas Bravas (surprisingly sooo good!) 2. Prosciutto Crostinis (our 2nd favorite with a good mix of sweet & salty)  3. Cherry Glazed Lamb Lollipops (these were good but a bit too raw for us so we asked for them to be cooked a little longer and then they came out perfect)  4. Market Mac & Cheese (our least favorite; kind of bland)  Good, friendly service. Will be back again.

Apart from the sweet potato gnocchi I have never been blown away by any dish here. The food is good and serviceable but not great.   I can't stand that they charge a $5 for guys and not girls. Just pure evidence that they do it because they can get away with it. Drinks are typical pour and serve drinks with watered down and under poured liquor. So much potential here, but wasted. Can be fun to party at but usually gets too crowded.

Cool pub-like atmosphere with a slight lounge feel. The half order of lamb came with a decent side salad which was all a steal for $9 and pretty tasty, though the sauce was very sweet. Zucchini salad was a cool idea but not much in flavor. Tried the brussels, mac, beet falafel and all was okay tasting but beautiful in presentation. Reasonable prices for tapas. Bottle of bubbly Grigio for $15, steal. The food is a solid three (though my dining companions would rate it higher), but the value, ingenuity, service, and atmosphere would make it worth another try.
Just mediocre. Not much on menu choices.  The ambiance of a very old irish pub is kind of cool.  Hear they have a great banquet room upstairs.

Two words: green beans. Amazing! The Spinach dip is also amazing, just wish it came with a bit more bread to dip. Great atmosphere and I really like the historic aspect. The plates are small, but my boyfriend and I ordered 3 plates and it was plenty to share. They have a DJ after hours upstairs, lots of fun.

Great small plates, macaroni and cheese wings mashed potato croquettes. Service was exceptional sat at the upstairs bar. At one point had all 3 bartenders within a few minutes of each other, ask if I needed another drink when I finished. What s nice change most places on a busy Friday night, you could die at the bar and no one would notice. Also had a nice vibe how can you go wrong with exposed brick and wood!  Will definitely be back can't wait to try some of the other menu items.

Came here for a Bloody Mary after brunch as we went to brunch before noon somewhere else. They have a Bloody Mary bar set up with everything you could want. I loved it. Our bartender also gave us biscuits to eat with sides of apple butter and jam even though we were just there to get a drink. It was pretty busy but we were able to get seats at the bar easily. Our bartender was very friendly and attentive. The dinner and brunch menus both looked so good that I will definitely be back to try their food and I look forward to it! Would recommend making reservations though because I did try to come here for dinner one night and they were full.

We didn't try to come here! We went to Ashbury first and were quoted a long wait time, so asked what other options were in the area and they directed us to dandelion market and O.M.G. I am so happy we were!! Food is amazing, mimosas are fantastic, service is great and we love the atmosphere! This place is to die for! Highly recommend!!

Bloody mary bar - first I've ever seen something like that. We had one of the omlettes that were a bit dry. Very cool location - near Thai Basil. Natural-oriented choices... a little different breakfast place.

Love eating tapas, I get bored with a huge plate full of the same thing.  We liked everything we had, but especially the shrimp and grits and mac and cheese.  But for me its the perfect combo of atmosphere and food.  Cool, laid back and dark for a night out, and the upstairs turns into a dance floor on weekends.  Love it!

We liked the space, all old wood and exposed brick. The first off-putting thing was the hostess, who seemed out of it when we arrived and didn't fully engage us, no biggie but for a place that I thought was supposed to be a little extra nice, or even cool, this is a small ding. We sat upstairs and again, it's a great space. Was 7ish on Saturday night and wasn't that busy. We ordered the roasted olives, deconstructed caprese, portabella fries, ahi and steak skewers. The olives were good and lot's of them; nice to have on the table for the rest of the meal. The fries came out next and were really tasty, the homemade ketchup is awesome, I think they were fried with panko crumbs, was reminiscent of tempura. The caprese was a letdown; the fried balls of mozz really masked the flavor of the cheese and there were only small bits of basil on the tomatoes. Overall an experiment gone wrong with a classic appetizer and one that we in particular love. Ahi tuna was done perfectly, complaint here being the wasabi sauce does not have enought wasabi; not enough heat. Steak skewers were tasty, korean style. We asked about dessert and were disappointed to find no chocolate representation aside from chocolate ice cream. Chocoholics beware. Overall the food was good but not great. I had high expectations after having heard many great things from friends. Another thing that really bothered me was that as small plate after small plate kept coming out, none were cleared from our table. We had to pile them up ourselves. What's up with that? A perfectly fine place, several other dishes I would like to try. Still not a breakthrough restaurant for Charlotte.

American Fusion Tapas. Rustic, dark, restaurant with friendly service.  Definitely order: *Shrimp & Grits (9) - not to tomatoey, the grits was a polenta cake, best tapa *Sweet & Spicy Green Beans (7) - Szechuan sauce, macadamia nuts, slighly sweet and spicy, great crunch *Sweet Potato Gnocchi (8.5) - great texture and sweet potato flavor *Meatballs Marinara (9) - very lean meat, great tapa! *Pan Seared Scallops (17) - the collard greens were great while the pineapple was an interesting topping, perfectly cooked scallop  Try at your own discretion: *Prosciutto Crostinis (9) - more of a baguette than a crostini, came out soggy and heavy *Cured Meat & Cheese Board (14) - average board with 3 meats, 3 cheeses, baguette, honey comb, blackberry jam, spicy mustard *Arugula Salad (10) - spiced watermelon, cornbread croutons, feta, lemon vinaigrette, very light and the flavors are untouched *Zucchini Pasta (8) -spiral zucchini, pickled beets, pumpkin seeds, basil, smoked tomato vinaigrette, if you get the meatballs, that marinara makes this a lot better, cold pasta, wasn't memorable  Wasn't a fan of having to trek upstairs to be seated when the downstairs area had availability. Friendly service. Twinkle toes ($10) cranberry prosecco was good. Clean bathroom. There are plenty of tapas restaurants in Charlotte and Dandelion Market features fusion flavors like the green beans and the scallops but does a great job maintaining core flavors too - like the meatballs and arugula salad.  Stop by if you're not too adventurous or if you have a big group that wants to try it all for $295!

OMG.  Amazing combinations of flavors.  The shrimp n grits is to die for w the perfect mix of spicy red pepper cream sauce tempered with the goat cheese dollop.  And never thought green beans could be so good when they combine the szechuan spicy w crushed macadamia nuts. Top it off with the browny Sunday and 5  doesn't say enough.
Really great place for lunch or dinner. Staff is very friendly and the ambiance/ decor is really cute. Also a great spot to stop by for a few drinks with friends.

I came here for brunch and plain&simple, food = great and ambiance = eh. It's inside of a dark bar with no outdoor seating and tables closely packed. However, the breakfast menu was great with multiple options, a whole bloody mary bar, and warm buscuits served before the meal. I would say it's the best brunch place i've visited in Uptown in terms of food, but other options like 5Church have more of a comfortable and open setting. I also felt the menu was a bit pricey, but if you're interested in options like the Chesapeake omelette with crab and shrimp, then it's worth the extra change.

Brought a group of 13 to Dandelion on Friday night and had an absolutely amazing experience. They put us at a huge table upstairs and we ordered "The Whole Market" which is everything on the small plates menu. By the end of it we were so full we couldn't eat another bite! Everyone told me what a great choice of restaurants I had made and how much they enjoyed every single dish. The Lollipops stood out along with the Ahi Tuna, Calamari, and Sweet Potato Gnocchi......Service was outstanding as well.

My wife and I have been coming here for a long time.  We love you long time, Dandelion Market.  We just came here for our 16th anniversary!  I know, big spender.  I even wore my jeans from 2005, not the 90's beauties she's been trying to throw away.   It's a good joint.  Location is perfect and has a great vibe.  Lighting and bar are great.  Food is always consultant, even if you don't like the selection, it's at the top of its game.

I went here while on a business trip in Charlotte. I had heard from the locals that they had a good brunch and a bloody mary bar, so I trekked up there on my own on a Sunday afternoon. After debating the menu for a while  I ordered the Prosciutto Benny. I wish I could have ordered like four things because they all looked good, but eventually I went with the Prosciutto based on a Yelp recommendation. I was not disappointed.  The ambiance was almost like modern Tavern or bed and breakfast in the city. Very cozy with wooden floors. Not very crowded when I went. Oh.....and while I wasn't able to enjoy the Bloody Mary bar that day it had my mouth watering the whole time. Self-serve style with the toppings and pretty much every topping you can imagine including cold prawns for an extra couple bucks. Drinks looked reasonably priced too.  Great place for brunch, especially with a group of friends who like to have a good time. Casual. Be prepared to tap a DD or taxi if you plan on hitting the Bloody Mary bar. Things could get crazy. I hear it turns in to a crowded hot spot on Fridays and Saturdays.

I had a great meal here with friends last weekend. The wine is reasonably priced, as is the food. The tapas menu is perfect for dining with friends as it allows everyone to try lots of things on the menu.   We finished up right at 10, which is good since that's when the upstairs apparently turns unto a club and is super loud. I'll definitely go back again for dinner.
Service was good Got the Brussels sprouts lamb lollipops and seared ahi tuna. All were good. Great selection of wine and craft beers. Casual low key spot.

This place was absolutely incredible.  For 300 dollars you can order the entire menu...which we considered but instead ordered 18 menu items for our party of six...plus 3 desserts.  Everything was really good.  Dont miss the sliders, green beans and potato croquets.  The stuffed pepper was the only item no one liked.  It tasted like a bagel bite. The desserts were all good, but the Apple Ravioli was the best by far.  Btw...Even though dinner is tapas..desserts are full size.   I highly recommend Dandelion Market for groups of friends.  I cant wait to go back. And try their brunch!
Favorite small plates restaurant in town! Everything is delicious. Personal favorite is the Southern Caprese Salad.

I have only been to Dandelion Market for only drinks and dancing. I will need to try it out for dinner. It is your typically bar on a Saturday night but with more bumping and grinding. The music is a lot of rap and dub step so i'm not a huge fan of it. The upstairs gets really crowded and it can be hard to move around a lot. I don't know if this is every Saturday but last time i was there girls didn't have to pay cover so that's always a bonus. This is a place that i wouldn't necessarily choice to go to but i won't complained if i get dragged there.

I must say I was pretty impressed with the wings and fries I've had. The fries were really crisp and the wings were smokey with a great char.   The beer selection isn't bad but I've come to realize these southern breweries just can't do IPAs well.

So Ive been to Dandelion twice to eat and all in all had a fairly good experience (solid 3.5 stars)   The first was for Brunch where I had a yummy Bellini and the Torta Rustica. The Torta is HUGE and is certainly a sight to behold. The cold cuts were fresh and the bread was tasty and crusty. The star of the show was definitely the French Fries...wow they were good!   The second time I came for a late night appetizer and settled on the Calamari. Instead of the usual cocktail or marinara sauce they were served with a Lemon Garlic Aioli. At first I really enjoyed the Aioli but it did become too much so I had to ask for the Marinara. I did not enjoy the Marinara at all unfortunately. The Calamari were fairly small rings and were overly salted. I would not recommend these as a meal for one - it was a bit too much especially with the salt content.  I will say the atmosphere day or night is great ! The  prices are very reasonable as well ( $7 for calamari $8 for Torta).   Overall I plan on returning to try some other things

Visited recently for a bachelorette party and was not disappointed. Food and service (thanks, Jeff) were excellent. I highly recommend the Prosciutto Crostini, Fried Calamari, Fruit and Nut Salad, Southern Caprese, and Pan Seared Scallops. I don't care for sage, but everyone who ordered the Sweet Potato Gnocchi seemed to enjoy it. Mucho Gusto cocktail and Lemon Pound Cake shot were delicious.   Shrimp and grits were lacking (grits are fried) and the mac and cheese was too smoky (think ashtray). Other than that, definitely looking forward to going back!

My coworkers and I walked down to Dandelion Market for lunch on a weekday. for some reason, the upstairs dining room was not open this day so we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table to be seated. One of my employees was pregnant and in her third trimester so she was not able to stand for too long. Luckily for us, they had two comfy leather chairs in the dining area for her sit while we waited. The service took a little longer than you would expect for lunch. Everyone ordered a lunch combo or a salad. The sandwiches were large and looked delicious. I ordered the market salad $6 and added ahi tuna $6. It was one of the best salads I have ever had. They lightly toss it with a vinaigrette and I love goat cheese, dried cranberries, pine nuts, spring mix and of course, ahi tuna! The best salad ever! Everyone enjoyed their meal immensely.

Dandelion market was a fun experience ! I went here with a group of about 25 people from work and they have a large enough space to accommodate multiple large groups/parties at once. The menu is tapas/small plates so kinda designed to share. I tried the mediterranean trio, szechuan string beans, sweet potato gnocchi, black bean sliders along with tiramisu, apple cheesecake and the brownie sundae. The only things I was disappointed with was the dessert menu, and ofcourse the desserts themselves. Shouldn't it be very hard to mess up a simple classic chocolate brownie? Well, theirs was hard and a little bland. The tiramisu was more whipped cream than anything, very very sweet and with hardy any coffee flavor. The cheesecake I liked! All the savory dishes we ordered were delicious too - my fav being the sweet potato gnocchi. This was HEAVENLY! You only get a couple pieces of gnocchi per serving so beware, because you will get hooked.  I was too excited to talk about the food and now that I have it out in the open, I will proceed to say that we got excellent service. Our server was very sweet and helpful and attentive even though we were a large group and clearly not very easy to manage. They have wooden interiors that impart a very intimate, cozy feeling to the restaurant. Love it!  Did I mention they have a kickass cocktails menu? :)

This place is a fun spot at night but a little overpriced for food. The food is mostly tappas and although not bad, it's nothing special for the price. The place turns into a giant dance club upstairs on the weekends but still has the downstairs as a chill sport for those not interested in the big crowd.
Love their brunch on Sundays! Always have great service and on Monday nights they have a special on draft beers. I love the upstairs bar...so spacious and the ambience is wonderful!

Enjoyed my dinner with a friend here. Cool atmosphere and Jeff gave great service! I had the wings and shared brussel sprouts and green beans. Both of the vegetables had great flavor!! I really enjoyed the wings as well. Thought it was still a little pricey for the amount of food-- but thats to be expected with small plates. Would definitely go back again!

The food is absolutely delicious. This was my first time here & my friend & I enjoyed each plate that we ordered. It's a small plates restaurant that has a great variety of options. The Roasted Garlic Hummus is so good, & so is the Stuffed Poblano Pepper.

Me and my boyfriend went here for brunch over the weekend. We were told that there would be a wait of about 20 min, but we got seated in 10 min. The service is very friendly and efficient. I ordered the Low Country Hash without the eggs, and my boyfriend ordered the Migas. They were both decent after adding some salt and hot sauce... Greasy, but decent. The atmosphere here is a little weird for a brunch place. It's dark and dingy inside, like a bar (which I understand it is), but I like brunch places to be more lit up with natural lighting and larger windows, because, duh, it should brighten you up after a lazy morning! Also, any time someone opened the door to enter or leave, there was a gust of cold air that blew right in, and it was 30F outside! At one point, the hostess held the door open for a good amount of time, for a group of people descending down the stairs. Like, is that chivalry really necessary? And if it is, can't you just open the door for them when they get to it, instead of holding it open while they are 20 feet away as the other diners get frozen to their bones? I believe the second floor might be nicer, but that's not where they seated us so that's that. Also, what kind of a brunch place does not carry anything other than whole milk? No 2%, no skim, not even soy milk! So, overall, my experience was just meh. I don't think I'll go back.

This is definitely one of my favorite tapas bar. My favorite thing on the menu is the calamari! Big and juicy. Breading is so light. The lemon aioli sauce is on point. I've tried the beef sticks and they were ok. Crab cakes were good but small. Macaroni and cheese wasn't that great. They were almost too smoky. It smelled and tasted like cigarettes. My fianc√© tried the lamb and he loved it. Hamburgers were also good and filling! Atmosphere is nice and dark.

Do not even try! I have never been treated more rudely in my entirely life. The staff is completely disgusting. Absolutely avoid this place! Can't believe I have to even gove one star because it's an absolute zero from all of us.

cosy rustic spot. wooden shoes and modern paintings line the walls.   extensive beer selection. i am a beer girl (ipa being my favorite vairetal). and hailing from california, was very very very HAPPY to see stone's arrogant bastard ON TAP.   great place for groups of 2-6, apps, and craft brew. order the antipasti board and the jalapeno poppers (these are not fried, my friends, baked and oh. so. good.)

Small plate restaurants are dangerous. I want it all, order it all, and always join the clean plate club.   Our first time here, super enjoyed it. Service was relatively fast and attentive. The plates come out in no order so don't be a picky pants about that.  We had the beet salad (more salad than beet but good), southern caprese (fried green tomatoes and mozzarella-so good we ordered a second helping), tuna crudo, scallops (perfectly seared but you get 3 so there could be a fork injury with 2 diners), Brussels sprouts (pretty good but not as good as Tupelo Honey), green beans (holy smokes they were killer).   Wished we had saved room for dessert but we will be back.

We had our 30th bday party here last night  and the service was awesome.  Our reservation was at 8 but we didn't get seated until 8:40 (everyone was hungry and somewhat upset) but the servers and maybe manager took really good care of us. I understand you can't predict when table is going to leave even after paying their tab. They (server, manager, bartenders, and host) all did an amazing job in making sure we walked out happy.

I wanted this to be good so bad! The menu  items looked amazing but the dishes were hit & miss. This place was LOUD! Trying to have a conversation was almost impossible!  The service was not good. We had a table of six & our server took an order for 2 ( SMALL ) plates & didn't return to take orders for more for nearly 15 minutes when we initially wanted to order 6 plates. She just kinda took the order for 2 & left. The fried pickles & the zucchini ribbon pasta were excellent!  The black bean sliders should have gone back! They were pasty & flavorless. The crab & avocado was in desperate need of salt & the sauce did not complement well. The fried green tomatoes were also in disparate need of salt & the breading was too heavy. The shrimp & grits were very good! The pumpkin cheesecake was delicious except the oatmeal cookie crust was so think and hard I literally have to hammer it with my spoon to brake it up in order to eat.  The Long Island drink was not the worst but nothing to rave about either.
Visiting Charlotte and came across this place in our brunch search. Delicious food at a reasonable price. Cute, relaxed atmosphere and awesome Bloody Mary bar. Highly recommend.

So, first of all, a couple of disclaimers: 1. My only experience with Dandelion Market was on a Saturday night.  2. I am not from Charlotte, so therefore not familiar with the best places to go or neighborhoods to seek out my kind of scene.  3. I do not do well in homogeneous environments.   So yeah, I didn't like this place. On the night I was there, it was disgustingly packed. As in, can't turn around, have to elbow people, feel really bad for the short people, feeling claustrophobic kind of crowded. It was insanely uncomfortable, especially because the crowd looked so... Stepford. If J. Crew doesn't make up the majority of your closet, don't expect to find your kind of crowd here. Just so you know.   Nothing they can do about that, I feel like it pervades most of Charlotte, but they *can* control the crowds. Even when we went downstairs we found ourselves standing in the entryway just for a little bit of breathing room.   They've got a fine beer list but when I asked for a second Two Hearted Ale they made a big deal about changing out the kegs and then proceeded to totally forget about me. I had to flag down another bartender after waiting for 10 minutes, and he poured me one straight up. Not sure what it is about this place that draws in such a large percentage of the city's population, but I think it's safe to say that I don't get it.

Great wine list and selection of local craft beers. Definitely has the feel of quaint places you would see in San Francisco and New York. The downstairs area feels much more warm and hip then the upstairs. Our most favorite visits have actually been sitting at the bar. The small plates are a perfect compliment to an after work cocktail. Fun spot!

Dandelion is a great place to grab a casual bite to eat or get some drinks. With the tapas style setup, I really like to come here with a plan to share plates.   In our two visits, my girlfriend and my favorite plates would have to be the lamb lollipops, brussell sprouts, and most of all the sweet potato gnocchi! The lamb lollipops are tender and come with a nice arugula salad with feta cheese and a tasty vinaigrette. Both of us have never liked brussell sprouts, but we decided to give it a shot based on our waiter's strong recommendation last visit. I have to say, try them! They have bacon and sweet golden beets that overcome the brussell sprout taste and make the dish surprisingly delicious. Lastly, the sweet potato gnocchi... I have dreams about those puffy clouds of sweet potatoes covered in whatever is in the amazing sage brown butter sauce. I would eat these every single day if I could!  The servers have been very friendly and seem very laid back. The prices are a little high for the amount of food you get (as with just about every tapas style restaurant), but the quality is worth it in my opinion.

We LOVE Dandelion Market! It's become a practically weekly date night spot for my boyfriend and I! He's obsessed with the ahi tuna...so obsessed he eats two plates of it alone. The steak skewers are amazing and always cooked perfectly. My go to dishes are the sweet potato gnocchi and the sweet and spicy green beans. Literally no complaints! Tonight with the Yelp restaurant week discount we tried the prosciutto crostinis and as expected...so good!! The service is always great here too! And on the weekends you can dance here at night. Overall great spot!

Oooohhh cozy! That's exactly how I felt when I rolled into Dandelion Market last night.   Dandelion Market is one of those comfy, yet minimalist, bars that can certainly appeal to a variety of peeps. I'm a big fan of the exposed brick and duct work engulfing the restaurant. Upstairs, Dandelion Market provides a beautiful and expansive space for even more drinking, eating and general hanging out opportunities.   But let's get down to where they really shine - their beer offerings. While I'm not a beer gal, I was more than delighted with the Carolina Strawberry Ale, brewed just north of Charlotte in Mooresville. A hoppy mixture that twisted my taste buds with a strawberry effervescence. While it was probably "chick beer", I definitely appreciated the local love.   That's the great thing about Dandelion Market's beer selection - a fair amount of them are local. Hooray!   The service here was just great. Every bartender and server, on both the downstairs and upstairs levels, was just super friendly and laid back. It's the kind of place where you want everybody to know your name - and they definitely deliver.  I didn't get a chance to sample any eats here, but I look forward to coming back, grabbing a chick beer, listening to (another) great acoustic musician and relaxing in the market.
We were very impressed by the food and service.   As foodies I feel like we are picky, and this was awesome!

Brunch, lunch, dinner, date night, girls night, special occasions, happy hour, dancing, blackout drunk- seriously, this place covers it all and does it right.   Dando features a tapas style dinner menu. I always order the stuffed poblano pepper. The lamb lollipops are another favorite. Honestly, I think I've had everything. Shrimp & grits, sweet & spicy green beans, fried pickles- depending on your mood, I don't really think you can go wrong. You can order "Everything at the Market" for $295. For lunch, I always get the grilled cheese and tomato soup. It's perfection. Love their brunch- several egg bennie options, hangover hash, bloody mary bar ($7). Pro tip: make sure to ask about the quiche of the day!  Hours wise: dinner 7 days a week from 4-11pm, lunch Monday-Friday 11am-3pm, brunch Saturday-Sunday 10am-3pm. Bar is open until 2am. Couple dozen craft beers on draft and 25 wines for $25 a bottle.  After dinner, they pull the big community table upstairs up off the floor and up to the ceiling. Pretty cool. Great night spot for dancing. Even more importantly, it's an even better place for people watching. Enjoy.   Great staff here, the service is always top notch. With so many new places that continue to pop up in Charlotte and uptown, Dandelion is still a go-to spot for my friends and I.

I LOVE this place! I like the cozy, dimly lit atmosphere, the food is excellent with a great variety, they serve small plates/tapas for sharing. Also the wine list is great, I got a red wine from Montepulciano, Italy and it was amazing!!! You have to come here!

Having previously only been here after 11pm, I was pleasantly surprised to find that Dandelion Market doubles as a fantastic brunch spot.  Because of my aforementioned experience drinking there, I had to do boozy brunch. The bartender made an excellent Bloody Mary that actually had a good kick to it. It paired excellently with the Migas, which you must get!! It's a banging egg scramble served in a skillet with tortillas on the side. The combination of the Latino-flavored dish and the spicy drink was fabulous.  Not only were the food and drinks awesome, they were wonderfully priced as well. Dandelion's menu rivals chain prices for brunch and delivers high quality. I will definitely start coming here more for food!
Great spot! I've been here twice and split about 10 dishes with people. Everything has been delicious and they also have a great local beer selection!

Dandelion is an unusual place, I didn't try the food at dandy until after a dozen times of going there, mostly because I frequent this place late at nights, on weekends where It serves as one of the places to be in Charlotte if you're looking for a good time...but the food is surprisingly great, a solid brunch spot as well.

Loved this little place when we were last in Charlotte.  We grabbed an early dinner of small plates while we were walking through the Fourth Ward.  Everything we ordered was delicious, and our server was knowledgeable and friendly.  I'll definitely make a point to come back.  Although we loved everything, here's a breakdown on each dish: The Southern Caprese = heavenly.  CC said this mozzarella is what all mozzarella wishes it could be.  This unique twist on a caprese is what every caprese wishes it could be. Tuna Tartare - succulent tuna, with a nice bite Sauteed Scallops - perfectly cooked, tender.  The macadamia nuts make a nice variation of texture. Prosciutto Crostini - the flavors blended together perfectly Mac n' cheese - delicious, smoky flavor.  However, with how out-of-this-world most of the other dishes were, it falls a little lower on my list.

This place was really great. It's exactly what it looks like. Great tapas sized plates of food and a bar. The people were really friendly and the service was good. The food is great tasting and served hot. It's a low key relaxed place. Food is very rich and yummy.

When I walked into this place, the atmosphere of the restaurant definitely didn't strike me as a dandelion market. The restaurant is dark and has these very old style decorations. It's a cool place nonetheless.   We were seated at table with bar stools because they had quite a few large groups taking up some of the tables and this was the only option available. You can order your own or share a few to share. The portions are small so I recommend ordering about two if you're having a meal.  I ordered the baked potato croquettes and grilled steak skewers and got to try some of pan seared ahi tuna, dando brussel sprouts, meatballs marinara, and sweet potato gnocchi. I enjoyed the potato croquettes and grilled steak skewers. The croquettes were fried perfectly, crispy on the outside and the potatoes insides weren't clumpy and paired well with the dip. The skewers were a lot more tender than I thought they would come out, which was great. The ahi tuna was good, but it didn't stand out to me as anything exceptional. The brussel sprouts were fine, but I think they would be better if they were crispy. They felt a bit soggy. I also thought the meatballs and gnocchi were just A-OK.  Overall, food was decent, service was good, and atmosphere was unique.

Becoming a bar with a dance floor upstairs, this place has severely discriminatory and homosexist policies. Because I am a male, I was charged a separate entrance fee as my female counterparts. After calling the policy homosexist and discriminatory, I was told to leave and told I was "being an asshole" by both the bouncer and doorwoman.   Nothing special with this bar unless your scene is discriminatory homosexism. Avoid!

The food is absolutely AMAZING.   Calamari and spicy green beans are two of my favs.   Dislikes about this place: the drinks are priced more than apps. And the drinks are not that crafty or tasty.   I'm usually never one to complain about service, but our server literally mocked one of my best friends and it was extremely rude. Especially for it to be the day after Christmas.   Besides that, my visits here have been extraordinary from food, to drinks and the ambiance.

Been going to the bar here for about two years, but this past weekend was the first time I visited for food.  It was a birthday dinner and I was with about ten other ladies, they were extremely attentive and the food came out very quickly.  We all ordered something different and passed each dish around the table for everyone to try.  This was also my birthday dinner, and they gave me a delicious heavenly piece of chocolate cake.  Ill definitely return, hopefully for brunch because I've heard that there brunch is the best part about the restaurant.

Got 4 plates. Each one was the bomb. Awesome variety of options without having a novel of a menu or sacrificing quality. Great atmosphere and service without being crazy expensive.   This is a place I could go to any day of the week.

Came to Charlotte for work and ate dinner here by myself. Nice ambience, cozy. It was interesting to have American tapas as I usually go to Spanish tapas restaurants. Limited healthy food options so I ordered the "healthiest" yet also tasty-sounding items on the menu:  - Half order (comes with 2) of the Cherry Glazed Lamb Lollipops- medium rare, dark sweet Cherries, spring mix, feta, red wine vinaigrette - Zucchini Lasagna- raw zucchini, heirloom tomatoes, sun dried tomato pesto, basil pesto, macadamia nut pesto   The lamb was cooked perfectly, but was not a fan of the cherry glaze. It's too sweet and candied, almost medicinal tasting. But if you don't eat the cherries or dip the lamb into the sauce, it still tastes good.   The zucchini lasagna was fresh tasting and flavorful. Keep in mind it is a cold dish so the zucchini has a super raw crunch and taste.

My favorite restaurant in uptown! I hosted at least 10 dinners in this place and tried almost everything on their menu. Almost nothing disappoints me.  One thing to note: if you truly want the Dandelion experience, come for their dinner menu!   Highly recommend: Steak skewers  Sweet potato gnocchi  Mac & Cheese Ahi Tuna

Dandelion Market is a great place for a late night "we're kinda hungry but not for a whole meal". We ordered 4 tapas plates: steak sqwers, mac n cheese, turkey meatballs, & calamari.   The steak was so tender and delicious! Calamari and mac n cheese were phenomenal! However, I'm not too sure if the turkey meatballs were fully cooked. They still seemed soft in the center.   Overall, the ambiance is great & I would recommend it.

My husband and I stopped in here for a couple drinks and some small plates to share while visiting Uptown over Labor Day weekend. We were seated upstairs in a booth across from the bar, near the bathrooms. Our waiter was nice, and when we told him we were from out of town he gave us recommendations for what to try both there and around the city (little did we know at that time that throughout the rest of the vacation, everyone else we talked to would recommend Dandelion Market!!!). The beer list was creative with "Tourists on Tap" and "Rotating Locals." We each ordered a beer as well as prosciutto crostinis, a mozzarella & pesto flatbread, and chorizo fundido. Everything came out beautifully. The flatbread was crispy, but not burnt. We actually enjoyed dipping the flatbread into the fundido! The fundido didn't have enough of those brown, crunchy chips, so it worked out perfect with the flatbread. I loved the bits of picked onion and chorizo mixed into the creamy queso. The crostinis were topped with prosciutto, goat cheese, fig preserves, caramelized onions, and a balsamic glaze. You really can't go wrong with prosciutto, but Dandelion Market definitely went above and beyond with this flavor combo! It was salty, with a slight sweetness from the preserves. It was crispy, but soft because of the goat cheese! Very enjoyable and highly recommend. Can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu!!!

A local friend brought us here saying it was her favorite. I loved the sophisticated, yet casual atmosphere. The server recommended 3 tapas per person, which would have been waaaaaaaaaaaay too much, so I'm glad our group started with one each, which was plenty with drinks. Each dish was unique and totally yummy.

By far the most stellar place I ate on my first trip to Charlotte. My best friend told me it was her favorite place, and boy was she right! From the rustic decor to the way they serve their espresso, everything was spot on.  We shared everything, of course, but a few of the super standouts were the LAMB -- omg some of the most tender and flavorful lamb I've ever had.  Their Brussels with golden beets and bacon is phenomenal -- as well as the red beet falafel!! The trio of fall Creme br√ªl√©e was wonderful as well.  And the fact that all of their wine bottles are only 25$ is awesome! I will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

It's the go-to bar after work.  Can't complain as it has friendly staff, solid bar food, nice selection of beers.  Came here to celebrate many things, one being the second time I had to take the MPRE bc North Carolina is so tight about requirements for out-of-state attorneys! All good, gave me a chance to catch up on beers and convo with work buds.    Only thing I don't like is the awkward ceiling support bars attached to some tables that are designed for 6 people to sit.  When I take out my wallet, phone (4s, sorry, I love it), keys, gum, eye drops, watch, cigarettes, headphones... I find my space limited! JK on the last 6 items, but still, it's a little tight.  Nothing they can really do about it I guess.   It's a nice after-work bar, came in on the day of the Taylor Swift concert but there were no attendees in attendance at that particular bar - shoulda headed over to Epicentre.  Regardless, had a great time there.  dmo out.

This place blew me away. I really enjoy comfortable, dark pubs & not only was it comfortable, but it was romantic as well. The flowers & dim candle light make for an excellent casual date night.   The food. Oh my gosh! I & my boyfriend were in heaven. The Lamb Pops with the cherry sauce was like crack topped with sprinkles. (I've never smoked crack, but you get the point) Even something as simple as green beans is taken to a whole new delicious level at the DM. (It goes down in the DM ;) ) Our service was excellent! She really went above & beyond to make our evening special.I love when places leave the cute pitchers of water on the table, because we drink A TON of water.   It's within walking distance to the Knights Stadium. A suggestion to the fellas: Take your girl to a Knights game, afterwards treat her to casual yet amazing dinner at the Dandelion Market. You will be super glad you took my advice.
The waitstaff was knowledgeable about their gluten free options,  the bartender was attentive and quick with great conversation, and the food was yummy!

So I have to share my experience here at Dandelions! It's phenomenal! I've been here three times in the past week and a half and can say I've had a five star experience every time. Being an extremely critical person of the restaurant business, having experience in it, I can say Dandelion Market exceeded all expectations I have for a restaurant. Friendly environment and ambience, great service, great unique cocktails, and AMAZING FOOD! I've had great service from waitresses such as Sam, and great educated bartenders such as Kenny!  Keep up the great work guys, you can now add another regular to your list!!

This is a great place for lunch and Sunday bunch!  Dandelion has a cool decor with wood floors, high ceilings, and two levels of dining.  I can't forget to mention that they also play awesome music.    Both levels have comfortable seating, and the noise level is low during breakfast and lunch.  I expect it's worse during happy hour due to the ceilings.  Their staff are very friendly and welcoming, service is usually fast and efficient, and their food keeps me coming back again and again.  I've been here many times for lunch, and while their flatbreads and salads are good, I've found my favorite dish in their grilled cheese and tomato soup.  Wow - it's yummy, AND so reasonably priced!  I've never had a better grilled cheese/soup combo anywhere else...it's that good!  My hubby and I recently ventured here for Sunday brunch, and we really enjoyed our meal.  To start, their coffee is good and strong, and they serve biscuits and corn muffins with butter, honey, and jelly while you wait.  The biscuits are small and slightly crispy.  I loved them.  The corn muffins needed a bit of salt, however.   There are lots of options for breakfast, but we tried the huevos rancheros (hubby) and ham/gruyere omelet (me).  Both were very good!  The huevos was served in a cast iron skillet with shredded steak, beans, corn, and a spicy sauce; it came with tortillas, pico, and sour cream on the side.  The huevos was topped with a fried egg (over-easy on the menu, but they gladly gave my hubby one that was over-medium).  We love Mexican food for breakfast, and my hubby enjoyed their unique version.    My ham/gruyere omelet was light and fluffy, with just the right amount of filling.  I chose grits as my side, topped with shredded Parmesan.  The grits had some kick to them (maybe white pepper?), and I really liked their flavor.    I highly recommend Dandelion for lunch or brunch!  And we plan to try them for dinner as well, since that's the only meal we haven't yet had there.

Great food and atmosphere. My go-to place for a casual dinner and for happy hour. My favorites are the tuna (large portion and always great) and the stuffed zucchini.   The bartenders and servers are attentive and friendly. They make an effort to learn names and greet us personally every time now.

This place is great! The food was excellent. The only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars is because the service wasn't great. Our waitress was very nice and good, but the kitchen and bar weren't getting our drinks or food out. That aside, it was a great night and I will most definitely be back sooner than later. What we ordered-  Flat bread Scallops  Mac and Cheese Fried potato ball of some sort. We re-ordered it because it was sooo good.

I never reviewed this place yet?! Everybody knows this place is like the little restaurant downstairs with a party upstairs. Not too fancy, not too dirty. Birthday parties, casual dinners, drinks with friends... Pretty much everything doable here. Not a bad place.

I really enjoyed this place even though expensive. There was not one dish I didn't enjoy and liked I could try a bunch of different things. My favorites were the chorizo pepper, fried pickles, Mac and cheese, crustinis  and the southern caprese. We also tried the sliders, artichoke dip, chile steak, and the lamb. Really the only thing I would not order again are the sliders and the steak, they were good but nothing out of the ordinary. We also got the salted caramel brownie for dessert. This is the only thing that's not a small portion, it came with two pretty large brownies and ice cream, was very yummy. The server was nice and didn't have to wait long for anything even though 6 on a Saturday night. I plan to come back again.

Dandelion is one of my favourite places uptown, food is good and I always go for tapas style. They update the menu often and that keeps it interesting, also on the weekend the upstairs part become a club so the atmosphere is very cool.

Pretty impressed with this place.    Good beer selection, I had a porter and it's just right.    The southern caprese was as good as other reviews have indicated.  The shrimp and grits was the perfect amount, although slightly too much heat for me.  The goat cheese topping the grits made it tolerable for me.  The grand finale for me was the lamp lollipops, the only thing I thought a tad disappointing was the lamb was not medium rare, but still very tender at medium done.  My server was so nice she asked the kitchen to re-make it!  I originally wanted to give this place a 4 star but it deserves a 5 star because they care!  I posted before and after so you be the judge of it.

The scallops are so good!  We had the surf and turf as well as the butter fried scallops -- so good!!  The crab and avocado salad was delicious, too.  I was not a fan of the caprese salad or the shrimp and grits, but then again, I'm not a southerner.

I've been to Dandelion Market for lunch 2-3x and for brunch once and have never been disappointed but I was blown away at their dinner. The tapas were perfect portions for sharing and there was nothing we ordered that wasn't delicious. The price was extremely fair as well. I will definitely be going back.

This place is delicious! I love the calamari, it is perfectly cooked...crisp and a touch of spice! Most everything that I've tried was good.  It gets very busy on weekends, so go early. Service is always good.  Can't wait to get back!!
Good share tapas plates. Great location. Decent prices. Good drink options. Inconsistency with food however

So lucky to end up here my first night in Charlotte. Food is phenomenal - recommend Cherry lamb lollipops & Mac & cheese (amazing but super filling). Had to go back my second night in town (convinced there can't be better food in Charlotte). Calamari was awesome!  Brian the bartender deserves a raise! Amazing service!

I kinda have a secret crush on this place, and it was randomly reinforced the other day by a killer, killer sammich. Its memory makes me want to write it a poem. But I suck at rhyming, so  The bun - perfectly toasted. A thin, sturdy layer of crust and charred onion giving way to sweet wheatiness, another layer of thin crunch sidling up to a ginormous, ridiculous, muffin topping, butter-saturated, smokey, fungusy portabella cap. A little bit of salt. A dash of balsamic. Pepper. A dollop of goat cheese and chopped tomato placed dead center, a teetery, balanced handful of bitey greens, most or all arugula, then another toasty onioncrunchbun, squashed every-so-slightly on top and skewered in place. Cheese as punctuation, not paragraph. A superb portoburger.  For 8 bucks. Add another giant fistful of delicately dressed greens between the two immaculately sliced sandwich halves, and I was in awe of what a mere 8 bones can get you for lunch.   I gotta come here more often.

I have been here a few times and have had a great experience every time.  The food is very tasty and well priced. Also, it is pretty cool that you can have a lot of variety for dinner since meals are tapas style.  The place is pretty big since there are two floors.  IMO downstairs is nicer since it is a little more intimate.  Regardless of what floor you are on, the staff is great and will guide you through the menue and recommend their favorites based on what you say you like or do not like.  If you want a relaxing fun dinner, this is a great place to go.

Decided to come here after passing it on my way to 5Church. Glad I decided to stop by instead.  Ordered: -Dando Crab Cakes: 4/5. Typical crab cakes, cooked well, flavorful sauce. 2x cakes served on a bed of leafy greens.  -Grilled Lamb Lollipops: 3.5/5. The lamb lollipops themselves were great, but I was not a huge fan of the sweet, black cherry based jus they were served on. -Surf and Turf: 5/5. Fantastic and definitely my favorite dish of the night. Tender scallops and perfectly cooked pork belly on an absolutely flavorful bed of sauce and pesto.  -Sweet and Spicy Green Beans: 3.5/5. Fairly typical green beans served with a sweet, and very mildly spicy sauce.   I would definitely come back in the future. Great selection of beer too.

Who is giving this 4 stars? Food was worst ever. We had meatball tapa that tasted like they bought them from Costco and dumped prego on top, really bad. Then they served us 2 uncooked Brussels sprout tapas in a row that were completely uncooked.  We also has scallops that were sandy and under cooked.  Good service but but poor food that I would expect to find at Applebee's.
Favorite date spot! From cocktails to brunch to tapas- this place has it ALL. The ambiance is perfect. Cozy yet upbeat. Great menu great service. YAAAAS, DANDELION. YAAAAS.

I love Dandelion!!! This is one of my absolute favorites in Charlotte.  From beer selection to the fantastic menu, it's always on my go to list!  Not to mention the wonderful staff and management are always eager to help.  Love this place!

The service at Dandelion Market was amazing!! My cousin and I visited yesterday. Nice low key spot! Mac and cheese was surprisingly good! Green beans awesome! Grilled chicken was a little spicy but still tasty.  Great times!    The two of us shared the following: Green beans, Mac and cheese, sliders, fries, and grilled chicken. It was too much food but the leftovers were great the next day.   Sorry forgot to take pics!

I have but one word for this place....EXCELLENT! We went there for tapas and a couple of drinks on a Friday night. They sat us in the bar upstairs. Dimly lit, but perfect ambience. We ordered the Mediterranean Trio for a starter, then we piled on their delicious small plates: steak skewers, macaroni, frittes, calamari, shrimp and grits, and the star of the meal....the Ahi Tuna! The meal and service were everything you could ask for. They were very attentive to the customers and made sure we had everything we needed. I can't wait to go back again!

Fantastic!  We were only in Charlotte for 24 hours and were so glad we chose to eat here!  It was a sleepy Sunday night, but the bartender was super helpful with suggestions for beer and plates.  After we ate, I wanted to kiss the chef.  It was that good.  The staff was excellent and very accommodating.  We started with the spinach, dried cranberry, pine nut and goat cheese salad, it was plenty for two, but because I'm a big fan of goat cheese, I would have liked more of it on top.  Next we had the Shrimp & Grits...Whoa.  Tasty buggers that pack some heat, but combined with the yummy cheesy grits cakes and roasted red pepper sauce, it was a great combo.  We had to order two more grit cakes, they were that addictive.  Next came my personal favorite, the lamb lollipops with greens and cherry sauce.  That is a "wanna slap yo momma" food!  Stupendous dish!  Next up was the Flat iron steak with mushrooms and onion straws! which was my dining companion's favorite of the night.  It was tender, flavorful and rich.  I was super full, but we ordered the Car Bomb Cupcake.  I wouldn't get it again.  The frosting was grainy, the cake a little dry and it was a disappointment.  It didn't evoke the classic car bomb flavors.  Parking is on the street where you can find it, free on weekends, or there is a garage nearby.  I would definitely go back if I was in town.

We stopped in for Sunday brunch with friends while in town.  The atmosphere is cool and trendy.  They had a solid bloody mary bar which I indulged in.   A couple of us got benedicts, I got huevos rancheros which was a substantial portion.  My husband got the prosciutto Benedict which was good but a little salty due to the prosciutto. We also ordered the french toast sticks for the table: YUMM! Coated in cinnamon sugar they were very tasty and just a little elevated from the Market Day ones you used to get in grade school.   Overall a good spot for brunch, friendly service and nice vibe!

I have been here with colleagues several times, and every time we have eaten here, we have had a good experience.  Almost every dish I have had here has been very well prepared and tasty. The portions are definitely more generous than you'd think (or than they tell you)!  Great spot for casual dinner and drinks, not bad for groups as well. A definite Uptown favorite.

Went here for an office event about a month ago.  Service was really great, food was pretty good and ambiance was fine for this type of group event. We initially sat at the communal table on the second floor but ended up migrating to the area under the stairs as it allowed us to network.   The servers were very flexible and kept the drinks flowing. The food was great - simple pub fare but overall well done. Loved the eggplant option, hummus, calamari, wings, and other dishes to share.

I had a dozen girlfriends in town and we decided to go to Dandelion Market for dinner. We were seated upstairs, and the atmosphere was nice- sort of dark, not fancy or anything, but just nice enough.   Since there were so many of us, we decided to order the menu item that includes every single tapas plate on the menu. I honestly think everyone should find a dozen of their closest friends and do exactly this, so that you get to taste everything on the menu instead of having to choose!  The food was absolutely amazing. When the plates started coming out, all of us were getting basically a bite of each plate. And we're looking at each other and thinking "uh-oh. This is never going to work". But then some of the plates are coming out where you're getting 2-4 bites. And then, 25 plates later, you're absolutely stuffed with truly fantastic food. The lamb lollipops were amazing, as were the scallops, flatbread pizzas, the cheese board, the mussels (a LOT of mussels!), the steak. I had ZERO complains about the food.  The service was good. I wish there had been a better way of staging the items, because it started off with a slow trickle, and then at one point we were just slammed with plates- there was no way to keep up with them!   I guess the wine list and beer list is good. I don't know. Someone else ordered all of our wine, and I don't get really picky when it comes to fermented grapes.  I would recommend Dandelion to anyone. Personally, I'd have a hard time coming back and only getting to choose a few plates. For around $25 per person (plus booze, of course), I thought the "try everything" option couldn't have been better. Will absolutely be coming back, as soon as I wrangle up 10 friends to go with me.

My boyfriend and I dined at Dandelion market for Yelp restaurant week. This was my first time having dinner there, and I won't be back.   The restaurant is located in Uptown (so I wouldn't suggest driving here unless you want to pay to park your car and then still have a good ways to walk). On a Monday evening the restaurant was empty, but the ambience was nice. Dandelion is located in a cool older building and boasts historic hardwood floors and dim lighting which is nice for a date night spot.  We liked only 2 of the 7 items we ordered. Additionally at a price tag of about $100 for a couple (including only a couple drinks) this place is not cheap, and there are far better tapas restaurants in Charlotte.   If you care for all the details; we tried a bunch of items: Brussels sprouts: I do not recommend. These were mushy and lacked any flavor - they weren't the fried or toasted Brussels you get at most restaurants. Cornbread: I would not recommend. It was So So dry and tasted like it had been made a week ago. Patatas Bravas: I would not recommend. These lacked flavor and tasted like they had been premade, left out, and reheated.  Wings: I did not try these (I'm not into wings) but my boyfriend said these were ok but not noteworthy. Prosciutto crostini: I WOULD recommend this. Of what we ordered it was the best (though that's not saying much). It was flavorful but super salty.  Stuffed Pepper: I would not recommend. This was poorly presented (looked like a pile of mush), it also didn't taste good. Apple Fritter desert: I WOULD recommend. This came with 2 fritters and vanilla ice cream. It was delicious and served hot!

We had some really really great plates and then some that were 'eh... We ordered 9 plates for the 4 of us- and that was plenty. This tapas bar definitely had larger 'small plate' portions than most other tapas restaurants that we've tried out.  Some of the plates were definitely fabulous!  The aioli that came with the calamari was delicious and the prosciutto crostini was a table favorite.  The Lamb lollipops were super yummy, as was the salad that they were served with.  The asparagus with the six minute egg were super and the pork belly was melt in your mouth delicious!  Some of the plates were duds- the queso fundido was passed on by one of the kids, and the potato dish, I can't even remember the name of it, was just yuck. The Brussels sprouts had a very nice flavor, but needed some caramelization or something.    Overall, a nice meal, definitely some pluses and some minuses, but good eats for sure.

This is one of my favorite lunch spots in CLT. The ambiance is a bit odd - it kind of feels like you're walking into a leftover vegetarian joint from the 60s, but overlook the looks. The food is fab!   My favorite thing there is the tomato soup and grilled cheese. I know, it sounds simple, but it's hard to do simple right. The grilled cheese is on thick bread, buttery and cheesy and yummy. The soup is perfection, hearty, tangy and rich. On a cold rainy day, there's nothing better.  The salads are great. Big, filling and the dressings all taste homemade. If you are looking for something different, the black bean sliders have just the right amount of spice to make you crave them.   The service can be spotty, but that seems to be a trend in uptown. Go, try Dandelion!

I can't get enough of this place.  I'm not overtly fond of the Saturday night deal, although if your looking for a packed bar with decent music come on Saturdays!  What I love is the rustic layout, friendly service, variety of food selections, and serving portions.  To me this is more of a tapas type of place, and I've yet to find something I do not like on the menu. I came to dinner with friends for my going away party... and pretty much ordered everything on the menu.  I didn't see till after they actually have an option to order the entire menu for $250!!  Should have done that as we spent a bit over $300, and that is just for five people.  The layout is great.  downstairs with some tables and a small bar, then upstairs with the big bar and a few more private tables.  A HUGE picnic table in the center (should fit like 20!).  If your in the mood for some decent food, an old time look, and are not down with the ultra modern lounges... COME HERE!  Mac n Cheese... damn I wish I had some right now

I love a great tapas restaurant and this is my favorite in Uptown! The atmosphere/ambiance is great and I enjoyed the service. The first time my husband and I went we got the beer sampler and for tapas we shared the trio of spreads (hummus is delish!), pan seared ahi tuna, and market meatballs. Oh and I'm pretty sure I threw in the market mac and cheese for good measure! I will admit that I went late night with a few friends and got a cured pepperoni flatbread and it wasn't very good at all. I am still going to give this place a 5 due to all of the other amazing dishes/experiences I've had. Too bad I don't live closer to the city so I can enjoy it more often.

Ambiance: fun but a little dark. I was very happy that they placed us next to a window so that the sun could filter in.  Wild Mushroom Pizza was a bit of a disappointment as the mushrooms appeared the standard grocery store variety.

It doesn't get much better than this for food/drinking than this place.  You might get lucky and have Drew as your bartender.  He will take care of you.  There have a wide variety of beers and great food/drink specials.  I really like $3 pints on Monday.  The fried pickles here are to die for.    Secret: Ask Drew about the LUNCHBOX drink.  It is one of my favorite drinks and he is the only one is Charlotte that makes it right.  Trust me.    -Ian M.

Busy Saturday night with the Hornets game just over and a private party upstairs. An hour wait for a table but got 2 seats at the bar in 10 minutes.  5 plates was too much food for my wife and I but the variety was awesome.  Add 2 glasses of wine, 2 delicious craft beers and a Woodford Reserve Bourbon for @$100 and you can't beat it.  Had the Wings, Short Ribs, Pork Belly, Prosciutto Crustini and the Mac and Cheese.  All delicious. Bar staff was very attentive and friendly.

This is review based on what I remember that one night I was there:  The bathroom's clean. The beer's tasty. It's a jumpoff for the jumpoffs. The floor upstairs feels like it might cave in.  (Thumbs up) for Dandelion Market. They've got a good thing going, I think.
Just had lunch here today at the bar the bartender great funny and fast best service ever
Best restaurant in uptown! The food is delicious and all of the drinks are made to perfection. We love coming here and love Zy. She's the best!

Great cocktails! We swooped in during #snOMG to check it out. They had a great beer selection and I liked my cocktails. Had a warm one with Apple infused whiskey that was excellent on a cold day. The next one was called cobbler, and it was also an amazing winter drink. We didn't try food, but I think we will be back to give that a go!

Delicious! Have been here several times and now love bringing family and friends when they are in town. It's where my boyfriend and I had our first date and we tend to revisit often. The food is perfect, we've never had a dish that is less than wonderful. The beer and cocktail selection is plentiful. The environment is laid back and cozy, with servers that have been wonderful every time.

The nicest bartender works here. He's Irish and just full of joy. It was so fun going in and having dessert and drinks with my husband. We got the raspberry cheesecake and it was delicious. Kind of a hole in the wall- but a lovely homey place!
